The conclusion of the protocol is vital to promote the effective sustainable development of guinea-bissau's fisheries sector, as well as of the industries and activities associated with it.  Even following the suspension of negotiations with Mauritania, the fisheries agreement between the European Union and Guinea-Bissau is today perhaps one of the most important agreements currently in force, since it allows access to mixed fishing activities, and that is why I have chosen to vote in favour of the proposal.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. ‒ While this recommendation contained some positive merits, specifically when it comes to investing in sustainable small-scale fisheries and socio-economic development, it failed to promote the more genuinely sustainable development of Guinea-Bissau’s fisheries sector and of related industries and activities, in particular small scale fisheries that greatly contribute to food security and local livelihoods. Moreover, it can be argued that the agreement does not go far enough in the context of securing and guaranteeing employment for local fishermen on-board EU vessels, it more or less states that opportunities for it employment should be exploited. Furthermore, while there is acknowledgment of the importance of gathering data on catches and conservation, there is not enough emphasis on the environment and conservation. It was for these reasons amongst others that I voted against this recommendation.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ I oppose these agreements, which have a whiff of exploitation about them. We should not be paying developing countries to plunder their natural resources. I therefore voted against the agreement.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I gave my consent to the conclusion of the Protocol setting out the fishing opportunities and financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. With this partnership, different ways can be explored of helping to develop long-term fishing policies for this region. This will not only benefit Guinea-Bissau but also for Europe in that region in the future.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 Due to the problems of transparency, illegal fishing and monitoring by the bodies responsible for monitoring the implementation of the agreement, I voted against this recommendation.

name: Aymeric CHAUPRADE
text: In writing. The purpose of this agreement is to allow European Union fishing vessels, including twelve tuna seiners and surface longliners, plus three caning tuna boats for France, to access the territorial waters of Guinea-Bissau. This represents a mutually beneficial partnership, especially since Guinea-Bissau does not have the means to combat illegal fishing. So I voted for this agreement.

name: Salvatore CICU
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report on the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Guinea-Bissau. This agreement is of considerable importance both for Guinea-Bissau and for the European fleets. However, the results achieved so far in the field of sectoral cooperation are insufficient. The report therefore calls on the Commission to take the necessary measures to establish mechanisms to ensure greater transparency and participation of beneficiaries, to review, if necessary, the part of the agreement concerning sectoral support and to improve the quantity and quality of information on catches.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this recommendation because I agree with its fundamental objective, namely the need to ensure the creation of fishing guarantees for European vessels in Guinea-Bissau waters. Developing a sustainable policy in this area is in the interests of both sides, and it is essential to focus on third countries in order to provide them with aid and technology, while we can obtain food from resources that are not properly exploited there. It earns our food, improves biodiversity in our seas, benefits the citizens and fishermen of Guinea-Bissau.

name: Carlos COELHO
text: in writing. \u2012 The procedures necessary for the signing of this new protocol had been suspended in 2012 due to the coup d'état in Guinea Bissau, and the European fleet ceased to work on the assumption that its safety could not be guaranteed. With the elections held in Guinea Bissau in May 2014, a new protocol between the parties was signed in November. This new protocol to the EU-Guinea-Bissau fisheries agreement provides for fishing opportunities for vessels from Spain, Italy, Portugal, France and Greece. The protocol lasts for three years and has been applied provisionally since 24 November 2014. Portugal holds, under this Protocol, two licences for surface longline and fishing for shrimp trawling (1060 TAB corresponding to about four vessels with the characteristics of the national fleet). With the suspension of negotiations with Mauritania, the EU-Guinea-Bissau fisheries agreement acquires increased importance and can even be considered one of the most important currently in force, and I therefore support this recommendation on the signing of the agreement in question.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour of this report, which takes stock of the benefits so far reaped by the EU through the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Guinea Bissau. It also calls for the Agreement to promote more genuinely sustainable development of the fisheries sector and for the Commission to develop its own means of data collecting on all catches so as to be better empowered to assess the impact of the Agreement on the marine ecosystem and on the fishing communities more accurately.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain the cover for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. Guine-Bissau, after thirty-five years of agreements, remains mired in poverty and its fisheries sector remains unwrapped. The European Union uses its economic supremacy to impose agreements that actually benefit industrial fishing. These agreements, in order to be carried out on an equal footing, must be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of peoples, so that no State or set of states shears the resources of third parties. In considering that this is not the case and for the reasons set out herein, I have not been able to consent to this agreement.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ Since 1980, the fleets of EEC/EU Member States have had access to fishing opportunities in Guinea-Bissau’s waters. However, owing to the coup d’état in the Republic of Guinea-Bissau on 12 April 2012, the EU suspended the procedures required for a new protocol to be signed. In May 2014, elections were held in the country and a new protocol implementing the Fisheries Agreement between the EU and Guinea-Bissau was finally signed on 24 November 2014, covering a three-year period. Given its importance for both Guinea-Bissau and for EU fleets operating in that country’s waters I voted in favour of the report.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: In writing. This report recommends the adoption by the Council of the protocol between the EU and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. This protocol regulates the fishing opportunities available to European vessels and defines the financial counterparties granted to the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. This partnership allows European fishermen access to part of the untapped fish stocks in the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, while strengthening cooperation between the two sides as part of a development partnership for a sustainable fishing policy. The financial consideration provided for by the agreement is 9.2 million euros per year, of which 6.2 million for access to fisheries resources and 3 million for support for the development of the fishing sector in that country. In favour of this win-win partnership benefiting both the European fishing sector and the development of a third country, I voted for this text.

name: Rachida DATI
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this text to support research and the economy in countries such as the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. However, we must insist on more reliable information on local fisheries resources.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Agreements between the EU and third countries should be sought which promote the development of the Member States of the European Union without prejudice to their national and economic interests. This agreement harms the interests of our country because it will reduce fishing in our country because catches from third countries acquired at a much lower cost will be promoted.

name: Norbert ERDŐS
text: Writing. \u2012 In accordance with the guidelines of the European People's Party, I voted in favour of the adoption of a Protocol amending the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and Guinea-Bissau. It is also clear from the report on the new Protocol that, in order to maintain marine fish stocks, the European Union is being forced to impose appropriate restrictions on sea fishing. 30% of the earth's seas are overfished and marine fish stocks are at risk. Justified steps to maintain them will result in a continuous and significant reduction in the amount of marine fish fish fished. Therefore, the common fisheries policy should pay much more attention to sustainable fish farming, i.e. aquaculture, and in particular freshwater fish farming. A significant number of fish ponds in Hungary are located in Natura 2000 sites. These farms do not pose any threat to the natural assets of these areas. Moreover, in many cases it is precisely because of our closed-system fish ponds that they have created or preserved individual wetland associations. Consequently, freshwater aquaculture should be prioritised and given as much EU support as possible. Furthermore, this area should be freed from unduly stringent and unnecessary sustainability standards, which are justified only for sea fishing.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. \u2012 The new protocol to the EU-Guinea-Bissau fisheries agreement provides for fishing opportunities for vessels from Spain, Italy, Portugal, France and Greece. The protocol lasts for three years and has been applied provisionally since 24 November 2014. The financial contribution is EUR 9.2 million per year, corresponding to EUR 6.2 million for access to resources in guinea-bissau's economic zone and EUR 3 million for support for the development of the Guinean fisheries sector. The fishing opportunities allocated to the European fleet are: 3 700 TAB (Gross Tonnage) for freezer trawlers (shrimp) and 3,500 TAB for freezer trawlers (demersaland cephalopods); 28 freezer and longline tuna vessels and 12 tuna vessels with canes. Portugal holds, under this Protocol, two allowances for surface longline and fishing opportunities for shrimp trawling (1060 TAB corresponding to about four vessels with the characteristics of the national fleet). I voted in favour.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: In writing. I voted for this report because it is beneficial to both parties.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. \u2012 I am voting against because, by the same rapporteur's admission, very little has been achieved in the objectives of cooperation with the country in question.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Agreements between the EU and third countries should be sought to promote the development of the Member States of the European Union without prejudice to their national and economic interests. This agreement harms the interests of my country because it will cause fishing to be reduced in Greece, since catches from third countries acquired at much lower cost will be promoted. For the above reasons, my vote is against.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ I support the implementation of the Fisheries partnership Agreements with Guinea Bissau, Cape Verde and Madagascar, as they will provide fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the exclusive economic zones within the limits of the available surplus. They will grant support to the development of a good fisheries policy and grant EU vessels more fishing opportunities while respecting the environment. At the same time, they will help the development of a sustainable fisheries policy in those countries and promote the responsible exploitation of fishery resources. Those Protocols is of great importance from a financial perspective and for the country’s economy, in particular for the fisheries sector and the development of the local fisheries industry, and provides for enhanced scientific and administrative cooperation, while combating IUU fishing (Illegal, Unreported and Unregulated). Considering their importance for the partner countries and the EU fleets operating in these waters, I support their approval.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: Writing. \u2012 In my view, the fisheries agreement with Guinea-Bissau is of even greater importance and may be considered the most important of the agreements currently in force. I regret that the end of unilateral tariff discounts and the entry into force of the so-called Economic Partnership Agreements are severe restrictions and can pose serious risks and dangers to the country. In agreement with the rapporteur, I consider it important that Parliament approves the conclusion of this Protocol, given that the Protocol is of great importance both for Guinea-Bissau and for eu fleets operating in the country's waters. Furthermore, a more detailed assessment and consideration of the background and future possibilities of the agreement and the agreement would be necessary since the first fisheries agreement between the EU and Guinea-Bissau was signed 35 years ago, and the progress made in sectoral cooperation is extremely modest. This urgently needs to change. The agreement should promote the real sustainable development of guinea's fisheries sector and related industries and activities, increasing the added value remaining in the country as a result of the exploitation of the country's natural resources.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: Writing. I support the Fisheries Partnership Agreements. They are of immense importance to the non-EU countries of Guinea-Bissau, Cape Verde and Madagascar, as the financial performance of the fisheries sector and hence their economic development is driven by the financial performance. The people living there are not themselves able to use their natural fish resources. For us, these agreements are equally important, as they allow the European fishing fleet to fish in the waters of the partner countries. This will strengthen cooperation between the EU and Guinea-Bissau.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ President, I voted in favour of this report given the protocol concerned provides fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the exclusive economic zone of Guinea-Bissau within the limits of the available surplus. It aims to help the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and to promote the responsible exploitation of fishery resources. The Protocol is of great importance for Guinea-Bissau from a financial perspective and for the country’s economy, in particular for the fisheries sector and the development of the local fisheries industry. It provides for enhanced scientific and administrative cooperation, also with a view to combating IUU fishing.

name: Juan Carlos GIRAUTA VIDAL
text: in writing. ‒ Given the latest political turmoil in Guinea-Bissau, it is more important than ever to support this fisheries partnership agreement. This three year agreement contains a financial contribution of EUR 9.2 million per year in support for the overall development of Guinea-Bissau's fishing sector. A vital aspect of this agreement is that, while EU vessels will achieve greater fishing opportunities, stronger efforts will also be made to reinforce measures to prevent illegal and unreported fishing, which is of course positive progress.

name: Sylvie GODDYN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this agreement which will allow European Union fishing vessels to fish in the waters of Guinea-Bissau.  This is an important agreement as it involves 28 surface seiner/longliner tuna, 12 tuna caning, as well as a number of shrimp trawlers and freezer trawlers. France will benefit directly from this agreement, as it will be able to send 12 surface seiner and longliner tuna boats to the area and 3 tuna canning boats.  This agreement is also beneficial for Guinea-Bissau, which will receive 9,200,000 euros per year, of which 3,000,000 euros will be provided under the sectoral policy, which includes the development of port infrastructure.  In addition, each EU trawler will have to board sailors from Guinea-Bissau.  Finally, since Guinea-Bissau does not have the means to combat illegal fishing, its fishing area will be monitored by European vessels which will also collect scientific data to monitor the evolution of fish stocks. This agreement therefore plays the role of a development agreement, as it contributes to the political and economic stability of Guinea-Bissau.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. We voted against this report, as it does not meet the sustainable fishing criteria. We also consider that EU inputs do not benefit as indicated in the country's development report as the proposed plan lacks measurable objectives on this.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this recommendation because I feel that it will improve the EU’s relations with Guinea-Bissau, especially after the coup d’état in 2012.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for the recommendation on the draft on the conclusion of the Protocol. I believe that it is important to provide fishing opportunities to EU vessels in the waters of Guinea Bissau within the limits of the available surplus and to enhance the sectorial cooperation between both Parties. Since the first agreement between the EU and Guinea Bissau in 1980, there have been no significant achievements, and yet, this should be changed. In my opinion, this agreement must promote genuine sustainable development in the Guinean fisheries sector and related industries and activities, increasing the added value that stays in the country as a result of exploiting its natural resources.

name: Jytte GUTELAND
text: Written. We have chosen to abstain on the recommendation to conclude a fisheries agreement with Guinea-Bissau, as we cannot support an agreement that does not have a sufficient scientific basis in line with what is provided for in the basic regulation. Under the common fisheries policy, each agreement is to be concluded following an evaluation of stocks in order to ensure that surpluses are fished. The investigation on which this agreement is based is several years old, and since its completion there have been reports of corruption, falsely reported tonnage and illegal fishing.

name: Anja HAZEKAMP
text: Written. 'Fisheries agreements between the EU and developing countries are aimed at clearing the seas and oceans. European waters are vastly overfished. Even more fishing is devastating for biodiversity. Such policies harm not only animals, nature and the environment, but also the local population on earth. We just have to stop subsidized overfishing. Trading another round of fisheries agreements is not going to remedy the EU's failing fisheries policy. Nor is it going to get the EU to get its faltering fishing fleet going. That is why I voted against the EU-Guinea-Bissau fisheries agreement.

name: Pablo IGLESIAS
text: in writing. We voted against this report, as it does not meet the sustainable fishing criteria. We also consider that EU inputs do not benefit as indicated in the country's development report as the proposed plan lacks measurable objectives on this.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for the European Parliament's draft legislative resolution on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of the Protocol establishing fishing opportunities and the financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, as this gives consent for the conclusion of a Protocol promoting the authentic sustainable development of Guinea-Bissau's fisheries, with further validation of natural resources.  However, more reliable data on catches and the protection of fishing resources are needed in order to preserve biodiversity, improve fisheries-related economic branches and value traditional and other ways of fishing for local people. I also believe that the signing of such international acts must always take into account the interests of the European Union, but also of the third countries with which they are signed, counting on the local population.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: In writing. This fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau on fishing opportunities and financial consideration aims to allow EU fishing vessels access to guinea-Bissau waters.  In concrete terms, there are 28 tuna seiners/longliners, 12 tuna canners, as well as several shrimp trawlers and freezers. That is for France 15 ships and for a period of 3 years. In return, a fee must be paid and shipowners must board sailors from Guinea-Bissau. Overall, this is a good agreement for The Europeans and for the citizens of Guinea-Bissau who are unable to combat illegal fishing. So I voted for it.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the Fisheries Partnership Memorandum of Understanding with Guinea-Bissau, which is intended to regulate the fishing of European vessels in the Guinea-Bissau fishing area and sets a financial consideration. This new protocol is transparent, beneficial to both sides and is in line with better cooperation in the management of fisheries resources, which is why I welcome the positive vote of the European Parliament.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the recommendation because it has a dual purpose: to supply the European market while promoting sustainable fishing activity in Guinea-Bissau. EUROPEAN fisheries rules must be concerned with the environment.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. I am voting in favour of this report as it clearly sets out the problem of financing fisheries in that country and opens up opportunities for Europe.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the agreement, as it provides fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the exclusive economic zone of Guinea—Bissau within the limits of the available surplus. It is also of great importance for Guinea-Bissau from a financial perspective but also when it comes to rebuilding its fisheries sector and developing its local fisheries industry. It is an essential tool to add value to the fishing process and ultimately to export fisheries products into the EU.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. I have decided to give a favourable opinion on this proposal for the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Guinea-Bissau. The first fisheries agreement concluded between the EEC and Guinea-Bissau dates back to 1980. In 2014, a new protocol implementing the fisheries agreement was signed, with a financial contribution of €9.2 million per year.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: In writing. I voted for the legislative resolution on the fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau. This agreement allows access for European Union fishing vessels to guinea-Bissau waters: 28 surface seiners/longliners, 12 tuna caners and an unspecified number of shrimp trawlers and freezer trawlers. Specifically for France, it is 12 tuna seiners and longliners and 3 tuna caning. The agreement covers a three-year period. It will have to be evaluated after this period, but overall it is a good agreement for the Europeans and for Guinea-Bissau, which is failing to combat illegal fishing.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain the cover for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. Guinea-Bissau, after thirty-five years of agreements, remains mired in poverty and its fisheries sector remains unwrapped. The European Union uses its economic supremacy to impose agreements that actually benefit industrial fishing.  These agreements, in order to be carried out on an equal footing, must be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of peoples, so that no State or set of states shears the resources of third parties. In considering that this is not the case and for the reasons set out herein, I have not been able to consent to this agreement.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. The European Parliament approves the agreement between the European Union and Guinea-Bissau on fisheries since it is in the interests of both parties. The EU takes over the socio-economic level of the African country, which is in line with countries around the world, and which basically lives on agriculture and, to a large extent, so-called international donors such as the European Union. Following the suspension of negotiations with Mauritania, the EU-Guinea-Bissau fisheries agreement becomes even more important, becoming one of the most important currently in force. That is why I am in favour of such an agreement which undoubtedly takes place for the benefit of all.

name: Petr MACH
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted against this report. The common fisheries policy causes and cannot be supported by environmental disasters in the EU's seas and in the seas of third countries.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. ‒ The Republic of Guinea-Bissau, off the west coast of Africa, is considered one of the least developed countries in the world. However, its coastline is rich in fish resources and I therefore supported Representative Ferreira's recommendation, as the Agreement is an important tool for strengthening Guinea-Bissau's economic stability, reduces the need for international assistance and strengthens the fishing industry. The first fishing contract between the European Economic Community and Guinea-Bissau was signed in 1980, so Member States have had access to their waters ever since. Protocols for the implementation of the contract were in force until June 2012, and in November 2014 a new fishing contract was signed. Financial assistance provided by the EU amounts to €9.2 million per year and the main objectives of the Agreement are: to provide fishing opportunities for EU navigable facilities in Guinea-Bissau waters within permitted limits and to enhance cooperation as a basis for developing a sustainable fishing and exploitation of fish resources policy in Guinea-Bissau's fishing zone.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: Writing. \u2012 Fishing in the region has long been closely linked economically between the EU and Guinea-Bish. Support!

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the recommendation on the proposal for a Council Decision on the conclusion of the Protocol on the definition of fishing opportunities and financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bisau for the reasons I mentioned in detail in my speech to the plenary of the European Parliament on 8/9/2015.

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. ‒ Guinea-Bissau is one of the poorest, least developed countries in the world and it is highly indebted. It also has one of the world’s lowest levels of GDP per capita. The current Protocol covers a period of three years from the date of its signature. It is a multi-species agreement as it covers not only tuna but also prawns and cephalopods. The financial contribution amounts to 9.200.000EUR/year, including 3.000.000 EUR/year support to the sectoral fisheries policy of Guinea-Bissau. The Protocol provides fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the exclusive economic zone of Guinea-Bissau within the limits of the available surplus. The FPA is of great importance for Guinea-Bissau from a financial perspective but also when it comes to rebuilding its fisheries sector and developing its local (including artisanal) fisheries industry. It is an essential tool to add value to the fishing process and ultimately to export fisheries products into the EU. In addition, it can help reducing Guinea Bissau's dependency on cashew production and international aid, and strengthening the country’s economy whose weakness, compounded to its political, economic and financial instability, enabled narco cartels to become more and more powerful - a development which greatly destabilised the country.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 This partnership agreement concerns a country that has an economy based on the exclusive cultivation of cashew, with a consequent difficulty in differentiating. If on the one hand there are various potentials. It must also be said that the economic situation is seriously in crisis and that developments since agreement have been particularly poor. The political situation also remains unstable, although positive developments occurred in May 2014, with the presidential elections. This agreement could help to reduce Guinea-Bissau's dependence on cashew production and international aid, and would also strengthen the situation there. These are some of the reasons why I am in favour.

name: Barbara MATERA
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report signed by Mr Ferreira, because I believe that the results achieved in the field of sectoral cooperation between the EU and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau have not, in practice, produced positive results, despite the presence of a fisheries agreement signed 35 years ago. The new agreement should be responsible for promoting the effective sustainable development of the fisheries sector in Guinea-Bissau, as well as of any economic activity associated with it.

name: Gabriel MATO
text: in writing. I support the European Parliament's recommendation on the new EU fisheries protocol with Guinea Bissau. This is an agreement which is not only good for the Community fleet, which will have new possibilities for activity, but also for this country, since the EU is currently making agreements that go beyond the economic, and its putting in place a real framework of collaboration for the improvement of the signatory countries, in this case Guinea Bissau.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. As a need for sustainable development of the Guinea-Bissau fisheries sector, as well as related industries and activities, and the EU-Bissau fisheries agreement is of great importance, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. Two out of three fish consumed in Europe are imported. As fish consumption continues to grow, with slow but steady growth, a gap is widening to the detriment of southern countries. The report proposes to renew the EU fisheries agreement with Guinea-Bissau. Indeed, the coup d'état in Guinea-Bissau on 12 April 2012 led to the suspension by the European Union of the current protocols. The agreement before us allows 40 EU ships to fish off the coast of Guinea for a consideration of 9.2 million euros. Fish fishing off Guinea is clearly not essential for the EU, especially as it has the capacity and space to self-sufficient in fisheries resources. I am voting against this text.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: In writing. This fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau on fishing opportunities and financial consideration aims to allow EU fishing vessels access to guinea-Bissau waters.  In concrete terms, there are 28 tuna seiners/longliners, 12 tuna canners, as well as several shrimp trawlers and freezers. That is for France 15 ships and for a period of 3 years. In return, a fee must be paid and shipowners must board sailors from Guinea-Bissau. Overall, this is a good agreement for The Europeans and for the citizens of Guinea-Bissau who are unable to combat illegal fishing. I voted for it.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. \u2012 The new protocol to the EU-Guinea-Bissau fisheries agreement provides for fishing opportunities for vessels from Spain, Italy, Portugal, France and Greece. The protocol lasts for three years and has been applied provisionally since 24 November 2014. The financial contribution is EUR 9.2 million per year, corresponding to EUR 6.2 million for access to resources in guinea-bissau's economic zone and EUR 3 million for support for the development of the Guinean fisheries sector. I believe that this is a good protocol that will help guinea-bissau's economy, hence my vote in favour.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ Given the support of the Committee on Fisheries in moving this agreement forward, I voted to give my consent to this agreement with Guinea-Bissau.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report on Fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau because it is essential for the country’s economy and in particular for the fisheries sector and the development of the local fisheries industry. It provides for enhanced scientific and administrative cooperation, also with a view to combating IUU fishing. It aims to help the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and to promote the responsible exploitation of fishery resources.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 A fisheries agreement between the EEC and Guinea-Bissau has been in force since 1980 and is the most important of the agreements currently in force. On 10 February 2012, the Parties agreed on a new implementation protocol covering the period from 16 June 2012 to 15 June 2015. Following the military coup in the Republic of Guinea-Bissau on 12 April 2012, the Eu suspended the procedures for signing the Protocol. However, elections were held in the country in May 2014 and on 24 November 2014 a new implementing protocol to the EU-Guinea-Bissau Fisheries Agreement was finally signed. The Protocol is of great importance both for Guinea-Bissau and for eu fleets operating in the country's waters. I supported the recommendation.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 The first Fisheries Agreement concluded between the EEC and Guinea-Bissau dates back to 1980. Since that date, fleets in the EEC/EU Member States have had access to fishing opportunities in the waters of that country. Successive protocols for implementing the agreement have been in force since then until 15 June 2012. I am voting in favour of this report allowing EU fishing fleets to capture 3 700 TAB (Rough Tonnage) for freezer trawlers (shrimp) and 3 500 TAB for freezer trawlers (demersals and cephalopods), in addition to the free movement of 28 freezer and longliner vessels and 12 tuna vessels with canes. It should be stressed that the EU will contribute €9.2 million per year, corresponding to EUR 6.2 million for access to resources in the Guinea-Bissau Economic Zone and EUR 3 million to support the development of guinea-bissau's fisheries sector.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. This recommendation aims to allow european union fishing vessels to enter guinea-Bissau waters (including 12 surface tuna and longliners and 3 tuna caning boats for France) for a period of 3 years. This agreement is essential for the stability of the country. It aims to combat illegal (especially Chinese) fishing, to reassess stocks... However, the country is suspected of trafficking in fishing licenses organized by ministers and diplomats in Guinea-Bissau in return for a real plunder in favor of the West that promotes migration.  However, considering that this is a balanced and beneficial agreement for both sides, I have decided to vote in support, while remaining vigilant about its implementation.

name: Claude MORAES
text: in writing. ‒ This renewal of the Protocol provides fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the exclusive economic zone of Guinea—Bissau within the limits of the available surplus. The Protocol is of great importance for Guinea-Bissau from a financial perspective but also when it comes to rebuilding its fisheries sector and developing its local (including artisanal) fisheries industry. It is an essential tool to add value to the fishing process and ultimately to export fisheries products into the EU.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this text, which approves the partnership between the European Union and Guinea-Bissau for the responsible exploitation of fisheries resources in the guinea-Bissau fishing area. The aim is to promote sustainable and artisanal fishing, while strengthening the prevention of illegal fishing in guinea-Bissau's Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ).

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ The EU-Guinea-Bissau Fisheries Agreement has gained added importance following the suspension of negotiations with Mauritania. I voted for this recommendation regarding one of the most important agreements into force.

name: Norica NICOLAI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report because I believe that this new fisheries protocol between the EU and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau is a necessary and fair one for both parties. The amounts to be paid by the EU over the next three years will help the Government of Guinea-Bissau to develop the country's fishing and fish processing industry, as happened in 2014, when a health laboratory was opened to enable the certification of products for export to the EU. It also gives EU-flagged vessels access to Guinea-Bissau's marine resources, thereby bringing good quality products to European consumers.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: Writing. I support the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and Guinea-Bissau. Sustainable fishing is an important step for economic development.

name: Younous OMARJEE
text: In writing. I have decided to vote against this report on the PCP fisheries protocol signed in November 2014 between the European Union and Guinea-Bissau, because I consider that this agreement does not contain satisfactory counterparties for the economic and structural development of the fisheries sector in Guinea-Bissau. Indeed, despite the funds paid to that country in exchange for the exploitation of fish reserves, I consider it essential to include more significant measures to support the development of economic activity related to fishing in that country, otherwise the agreement is merely a plundering of the fisheries resources of the EEZ Guinea-Bissau.

name: Urmas PAET
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported. Since the 2014 presidential elections, the situation in the country has improved and the conclusion of the agreement will be beneficial, in particular, to Guinea-Bissau, as it helps to diversify sources of income and avoid dependence on only a few sources of exports and international aid. However, the agreement will also benefit the EU, whose vessels will receive fishing opportunities within the exclusive economic zone of Guinea-Bissau within the limits of the unused surplus.

name: Rolandas PAKSAS
text: Writing. – I support the recommendation made on the conclusion of the Protocol. The EU has a great responsibility in ensuring the conservation and sustainable management of international fisheries resources.  The Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Guinea-Bissau will ensure the implementation of the principles of good regulation of the fisheries sector and sound maritime governance. This is a crucial consensus, which provides for the possibility of mixed fisheries. It should be noted that this agreement will strengthen cooperation between the EU and Guinea-Bissau.  In addition, it will contribute to the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and will also contribute to ensuring that, in Guinea-Bissau's fishing zone, fishery resources are used responsibly.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 Once I understood the importance of the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the EU and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, as this is in fact one of the few agreements allowing access to mixed fishing activity, I paid particular attention to the issues related to the difficulty for the Republic of Guinea-Bissau of adapting to the health rules laid down by the EU. I agree with the rapporteur's proposals to improve this partnership. For these reasons, I have decided to vote in favour.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: Written. ‒The Fishermen's Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau sets out fishing opportunities and provides for a financial contribution to the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. The importance of this Protocol stems from the benefits it has for Guinea-Bissau fleets and European Union fleets operating in the country's waters.  The Protocol can have a positive impact on improving the quality and accuracy of data on all catches and on the protection status of fishing resources within the Territory of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, as well as on the ability of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau to develop its own capacity to obtain this important data. Given the importance of the Protocol on the development of the Fishing Policy of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, as well as its impact on the protection of fishing resources in this area, I support this Agreement.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: In writing. The agreement provides a number of counterparties and guarantees to prevent Guinea-Bissau from having its fisheries resources plundered. Indeed, a traffic in fishing licences has recently been discovered in this country and it is therefore necessary to act with the utmost caution to avoid overfishing. The agreement provides for the work of sailors from Guinea-Bissau, which is a good thing since it helps to limit economic emigration. Because of these benefits for both parties, I am voting in favour of this agreement.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: Written. ‒ Although the first agreement between Guinea-Bissau and the European Union was signed 35 years ago, the results of the consensual cooperation were largely absent. Given that Guinea-Bissau is one of the poorest areas in the world, with the lowest GDP per capita and one of the highest levels of indebtedness, but also with exceptional fish stocks, I support this recommendation on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of the Protocol establishing fishing opportunities and the financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau.  I also support the provision of this Agreement that €3 million will be invested in the development of Guinea-Bissau's fishing sector in order to make the most of the fishing potential they abound in and use for the sustainable development of the country.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. – I agree with the recommendations of my colleague Ferreira regarding the new Fisheries Partnership Agreement with the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. Such a protocol is important for both sides, both the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, for a number of reasons.  Guinea-Bissau is one of the least developed countries in the world, its population has a population of 1.4 million, the majority of whom live and work in a rural area. The agreement with the European Union will certainly contribute to the development of the economy of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau through a financial contribution of EUR 9.2 million per year over a period of 3 years.  The European Union, on the other hand, will gain access to the fishing area of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau through which, surely, both sides will benefit. At the same time, I support the rapporteur's recommendations on conducting a more detailed assessment of this Agreement as well as its effects in the future.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the recommendation on the EU-Guinea-Bissau fisheries partnership agreement. The financial consideration provided for by the agreement amounts to 9.2 million euros per year, or 6.2 million to guarantee the Union's access to the resources of the economic zone of Guinea-Bissau, and 3 million to support the development of the fishing sector in that country.

name: Frédérique RIES
text: In writing. The first fisheries agreement between the EEC and Guinea-Bissau dates back to 1980. Followed by several implementation protocols, it was carried out within the framework of strategies proposed by the European Union to the countries of the South, which provide financial and technical assistance to local fishermen against fishing rights for the European fleet. On Tuesday, the European Parliament once again approved this type of initiative. This small island, located on the west coast of Africa, has nearly 1.4 million people, most of them living below the poverty line with one of the lowest GDP in the world, and the coup d'état on 12 April 2012 only exacerbated political instability. Its economy depends largely on agriculture and the cultivation of cashew nuts, hence the need for this diversification brought by Europe. In concrete terms, the planned European aid is 9.2 million euros. In return, it allows many European vessels, trawlers freezers shrimpers, but also 28 freezer and longliner tuna boats and 12 tuna canners, to fish in the waters of Guinea-Bissau.

name: Liliana RODRIGUES
text: in writing. \u2012 Guinea-Bissau is among the least developed countries in the world and is heavily indebted. It also has one of the lowest levels of GDP per capita in the world. This protocol agreed between the EU and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau sets out the fishing opportunities and the financial consideration (EUR 9 200 000 per year), provided for by the fisheries partnership agreement in force between the two parties. The Protocol aims to provide fishing opportunities for EU vessels in Guinea-Bissau waters, within the limits of the available surplus, as well as to strengthen cooperation between the EU and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau in order to establish a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and the responsible exploitation of fisheries resources in the Guinea-Bissau fishing area. This agreement is of extreme importance for Guinea-Bissau, not only from a financial point of view, but also with regard to the rehabilitation of the fisheries sector and the development of local fisheries, including artisanal fishing. It is a serious contribution to strengthening the country's economy.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: in writing. This renewal is possible by the EU's decision to normalise its relations with Guinea Bissau, following democratic elections in 2014. I welcome this renewal which guarantees the sustainability of fishing activity in accordance with the principles of the new CFP, allowing the Galician cephalopod fleet access to this fishing ground, which means its return to European agreements after its expulsion from Mauritania in 2012. Up to 16 vessels will be able to operate in Guinean waters, thus easiing their situation. It will also ensure the activity of 20 Huelva seafood vessels, 14 freezer sequeros and 9 ported pipes in Bermeo, all affected by the suspension of the Mauritanian Agreement. France, Italy, Greece and Portugal also have fishing opportunities.  The Protocol will provide a disbursement of EUR 9.2 million per year, of which EUR 3 will be intended to strengthen Guinea Bissau's fisheries sector and administration. I thank the Commission for speeding up the procedure for approving this agreement, which is also a sign of support for the new democratic government and will lead to a major injection of liquidity for guinea Bissau's administration. For all this, I voted in favour.

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing. The main objective of the Protocol is to provide fishing opportunities for EU vessels in Guinea-Bissau waters within the limits of the available surplus and to strengthen cooperation between the EU and Guinea-Bissau, thereby creating a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and responsible exploitation of fisheries resources in guinea-bissau's exclusive economic zone. The overall financial contribution envisaged is EUR 9.2 million per year, corresponding to EUR 6.2 million for access to resources in the Guinea-Bissau Economic Zone and EUR 3 million to support the development of guinea-bissau's fisheries sector. Like the rapporteur, I believe that the adoption of this proposal should be completed as soon as possible, because we are dealing with a very relevant economic sector, especially in the riverside areas (European and Guinean).  For this reason, it is imperative that the Agreement promotes the effective sustainable development of the Guinean fisheries sector as well as related industries and activities, increasing the added value in the country as a result of the exploitation of its natural resources.

name: Massimiliano SALINI
text: in writing. \u2012 I agree with Mr Syod's proposal. Ferreira, on the fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau, urges Parliament to approve the conclusion of the protocol signed on 24 November 2014 between the Member States and Guinea-Bissau.

name: Matteo SALVINI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted against because the agreement would have a cost to the EU coffers that is completely disproportionate to the meagre benefits that can be achieved.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. We voted against this report, as it does not meet the sustainable fishing criteria. We also consider that EU inputs do not benefit as indicated in the country's development report as the proposed plan lacks measurable objectives on this.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain the cover for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. Guine-Bissau, after thirty-five years of agreements, remains mired in poverty and its fisheries sector remains unwrapped. The European Union uses its economic supremacy to impose agreements that actually benefit industrial fishing. These agreements, in order to be carried out on an equal footing, must be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of peoples, so that no State or set of states shears the resources of third parties. In considering that this is not the case and for the reasons set out herein, I have not been able to consent to this agreement.

name: Ricardo SERRÃO SANTOS
text: in writing. \u2012 This Protocol for the fishing of the European Union fleet in Guinea-Bissau seas is intended to allocate fishing opportunities to 28 freezer and longliner vessels and 12 tuna vessels with sugarcane. The expected financial contribution is EUR 9.2 million per year, corresponding to EUR 6.2 million for access to resources in the Guinea-Bissau Economic Zone and EUR 3 million for support for the development of guinea-bissau's fisheries sector. Although I am not directly responsible for the proposal for a recommendation for the fisheries agreement between the European Union and Guinea-Bissau, I agree with it. I believe, however, that we will have to take special care in monitoring this agreement. The political instability of this country is worrying and this agreement should be another factor of rapprochement with local authorities and communities. It is therefore important to monitor this Agreement by the Commission, ensuring that negligence and corruption are escaping. At first, I think it will be more important to support the training of human resources than to invest in structures in the fishing sector that can be neglected or become out of date.

name: Siôn SIMON
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this recommendation because I feel that it will improve the EU’s relations with Guinea-Bissau, especially after the coup d’état in 2012.

name: Davor ŠKRLEC
text: Written. ‒ This explanation of the vote comes as a criticism of the existing system of evaluation of the work of MEMBERS of the European Parliament solely on the basis of the statistical number of parliamentary activities potentiated in Croatia, which does not really reflect the actual quality and quantity of work, efficiency and most of all the success of parliamentary action.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. ‒I support this report because the Protocol to complement the Fishing Partnership Agreement between Europe and Guinea-Bissau is beneficial for both sides, as is the Agreement itself. Likewise, Europe has benefited from this Agreement for 35 years and should have them in the future.  For Europe, it is important that these treaties continue to fish in guinea-bissau's territorial waters and thus continue to supply quality seafood to its inhabitants. It is also good that this creates good relations between the two countries and the two continents and that both actors develop economically in this way.

name: Catherine STIHLER
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report which is a renewal of a Protocol that existed before Guinea-Bissau’s more recent turbulent times.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. ‒I support this report, whose protocol allows fishing within the sea borders of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, ensuring access to the surplus fishing potential of that Republic to European countries. The Protocol also underlines the institutional approach to fishing, i.e. modern and timely monitoring of data on the quantities and figures of fish caught, which will strengthen Guinea-Bissau's administrative capabilities and increase financial prosperity for both agreed parties, which makes it mutually beneficial.  In addition to the financial and administrative side, the protocol is useful for strengthening the electronic and technical capabilities of contracting parties and improves the technology necessary for scientific research of this agricultural branch as set out in Articles 3, 4, 5 and 6. The report also covers legal aspects of regulating interaction with the government, i.e. the Ministry of Fisheries of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau.

name: Patricija ŠULIN
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the recommendation on the draft Council Decision on the conclusion of the Protocol setting out the fishing opportunities and financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. European Union vessels should be provided with fishing opportunities in Guinea-Bissau waters within the limits of the surplus available and cooperation between the EU and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau should be strengthened. I also support the call by the Committee on Budgets for the Commission to report annually to Parliament and the Council on the results of the multiannual sectoral programme.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Agreements between the EU and third countries should be sought which promote the development of the Member States of the European Union without prejudice to their national and economic interests. This agreement harms the interests of our country because it will reduce fishing in our country because catches from third countries acquired at a much lower cost will be promoted.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ By voting in favour of the recommendation, I approved the conclusion of the protocol setting fishing opportunities and the financial compensation provided for in the partnership agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Guinea—Bissau. The measures adopted should also help to prevent illegal and unregulated fishing in the exclusive economic zone of Guinea-Bissau.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: Written. ‒ A new protocol granting fishing opportunities to EU Member States in guinea-bissau waters was due to be signed back in 2012, but due to the coup d'etat in the country, the European Union suspended the protocol, considering that the safety of its fishermen was not guaranteed in this area.  Following the de-escalation of the situation in the country and the holding of elections in 2014, a new fisheries agreement protocol with the European Union has been signed, but I do not think it has been sufficiently updated. Namely, this protocol does not maintain changes in fish stocks or reflect on the difficulties faced by fishermen in Guinea-Bissau.  Although Guinea-Bissau's waters have a rich supply of many valuable species such as shrimp, squamous, tuna and octopus, and the implementation of this agreement would be a great support to the country's fisheries itself, because of insufficient data preparation, it would vote abstain.

name: Romana TOMC
text: Writing. As this is about strengthening relations between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, I supported the recommendation in a coherent manner. The Recommendation proposes better management and conservation of fisheries resources through financial assistance from the European Union to create long-term country-specific plans. Because it is extremely important to plan for the sustainable depletion of marine resources, and because we need to strengthen relations between the EU and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: in writing. We voted against this report, as it does not meet the sustainable fishing criteria. We also consider that EU inputs do not benefit as indicated in the country's development report as the proposed plan lacks measurable objectives on this.

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: In writing. Agreement advantageous to both sides, especially since Guinea-Bissau does not have the means to combat illegal fishing. I vote FOR the adoption of this text.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: in writing. We voted against this report, as it does not meet the sustainable fishing criteria. We also consider that EU inputs do not benefit as indicated in the country's development report as the proposed plan lacks measurable objectives on this.

name: Ernest URTASUN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against these two points on the Fisheries agreement with Guinea-Bissau, because the ‘new’ protocol is problematic, as it takes no consideration of developments since it was negotiated, several years ago. It thus does not reflect the standards for agreements established in the reform of the CFP. Further, the alleged widespread corruption does not reflect well upon the way in which the protocol would be implemented.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: in writing. As well as providing for the draft Council Decision, Parliament needs to approve the signing of this Protocol in order, on the one hand, to grant fishing opportunities to European vessels and, on the other hand, to increase cooperation between the EU and Guinea-Bissa-U through the Partnership Agreement. To this end, I consider it necessary to vote in favour of this Recommendation.

name: Anneleen VAN BOSSUYT
text: Written. 'We recognise the value of the EU Fisheries Partnership Agreement with the Republic of Guinea-Bissau as an important tool for the country's fishing industry, the EU fleets operating there and the export opportunities it could create with Europe. However, we abstain from voting on the preliminary report with recommendations and the draft resolution on the implementation protocol, because it is too much a copy of the 2012 implementation protocol that was suspended following the military coup in April 2012. There are also lacks elements for the transition to more sustainable fisheries, such as an update on the conservation situation of fish stocks. For our N-VA delegation, the current protocol does not reflect the new political challenges following the upheavals in the country and the difficulties faced by the local fishing industry.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. \u2012 This agreement provides for financial consideration paid for access to that country's resources but also to support the development of the fisheries sector. It provides for fishing opportunities for the EU fleet. The economy of this country depends heavily on agriculture. In this sense, productive diversification is one of the challenges facing the country. Artisanal fishing, including subsistence fishing, ensures the survival of many fishing families (figures vary according to estimates). However, we accompany the rapporteur on the need to carry out a more detailed assessment and consideration of this agreement, its history and future prospects, in particular in terms of sectoral support.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. As a need for sustainable development of the Guinea-Bissau fisheries sector, as well as related industries and activities, and the EU-Bissau fisheries agreement is of great importance, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain at the heart of the framework for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. Guinea-Bissau, after thirty-five years of agreements, remains mired in poverty and its fisheries sector remains unwrapped. The European Union uses its economic supremacy to impose agreements that actually benefit industrial fishing. These agreements, in order to be carried out on an equal footing, would have to be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of the peoples, so that no State or group of States should wipe out the resources of third parties. Since the report by Mr Joao Ferreira also set out this analysis, I voted in favour.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. This three-year fisheries partnership agreement relates to the financial consideration paid by EU Member States for their vessels to be allowed to fish in guinea-Bissau waters. It concerns 28 tuna seiners/longliners, 12 tuna canners, as well as several shrimp trawlers and freezers. Of these vessels, 15 are French. Overall, this is a good agreement for French fishermen and for Guinea-Bissau, which has significant difficulties in combating illegal fishing. I therefore voted in favour of this text.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ Whilst I voted against the agreement, for the reasons outlined in that explanation, the report itself contains some mitigating positive features. For example, it wants to provide for local fisheries and processing. I therefore chose to abstain.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this proposal, which aims to conclude a Protocol to the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Guinea-Bissau. The first fisheries agreement with Guinea-Bissau was concluded in 1980 and has since been granted fishing opportunities in its waters by EU Member States. A number of protocols for the application of the Agreement were subsequently signed and the last Protocol was in force until 15 June 2012. The new EU-Guinea-Bissau agreement provides for a eur 9.2 million loan. The annual financial contribution of EUR 6,2 million was eur 6,2 million. access to the resources of the Guinea-Bissau economic zone and eur 3 million to support the development of the fishing sector in that country. I welcome the conclusion of this protocol because it is very important for both Guinea-Bissau and the European fleet fishing in the waters of this country. However, it is important to carry out a more detailed assessment of the future prospects of this agreement. A better link should be established between sector support under the Fisheries Agreement and development cooperation instruments. I agree with the need to improve the quantity and reliability of information on catches and the conservation situation of marine resources.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this win-win agreement over a three-year period. This fisheries agreement is in a way a development agreement that should contribute to the political stability of the country. In exchange for 9,200,000 euros per year, Guinea-Bissau will allow access to its territorial waters of European Union fishing vessels, including twelve tuna seiners and surface longliners as well as three French tuna caneers. In addition, each EU trawler must carry sailors from Guinea-Bissau, which will allow as many citizens of Guinea-Bissau to live and work in their country.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. I voted for the partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau because of the importance of its trade relations with the fishermen of the European Union, but also because fishing ensures the survival of thousands of Bissau-Guineans. The agreement also welcomes the improvement in the health situation on the ground and the positive development of the country since the presidential election in May 2014.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. As with the recommendation, this report aims to enable European ships to access the territorial waters of Guinea-Bissau. This agreement, which is particularly beneficial for France and the EU, is also beneficial for Guinea-Bissau, as financial consideration is provided as well as a fight against illegal fishing. As this agreement is balanced, I have decided to vote in favour.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I do not agree with the positions supported in the Ferreira report with regard to the fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau. I believe that the lack of respect for the EU's demands for sustainable fishing and greater efforts to combat illegal fishing, as well as poor compliance with hygiene and health legislation in fisheries, are sufficient reasons not to support this text with my vote.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. This renewal is made possible by the EU's decision to normalise its relations with Guinea-Bissáu, following democratic elections in 2014. I welcome this renewal which guarantees the sustainability of fishing activity in accordance with the principles of the new CFP, allowing the Galician cephalopod fleet access to this fishing ground, which means its return to European agreements after its expulsion from Mauritania in 2012. Up to 16 vessels will be able to operate in Guinean waters, thus easiing their situation. It will also ensure the activity of 20 Huelva seafood vessels, 14 freezer sequeros and 9 ported pipes in Bermeo, all affected by the suspension of the Mauritanian Agreement. France, Italy, Greece and Portugal also have fishing opportunities. The Protocol will provide a disbursement of EUR 9.2 million per year, of which EUR 3 will be intended to strengthen Guinea-Bissa's fisheries sector and administration. I thank the Commission for speeding up the procedure for approving this agreement, which is also a sign of support for the new democratic government and will lead to a significant injection of liquidity for the guinea-Bissau administration. For all this, I voted in favour.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of parliament's report on the Council Decision on the conclusion of a Protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau setting out the fishing opportunities and financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. This agreement is of great importance to both the EU fleets operating in Guinea-Bissau and Guinea-Bissau, and Parliament therefore considers that the results achieved so far in the area of sectoral cooperation are insufficient, and calls on the Commission to take all necessary steps: to develop mechanisms for greater transparency, accountability and participation of beneficiaries, in particular small-scale communities fishing with traditional gear. The possibilities provided for in the Protocol for the recruitment of local seafarers on BOARD EU vessels should be fully exploited. Parliament calls on the Commission and the Council, within the limits of their mandate, to inform Parliament without delay at all stages of the procedures relating to the new Protocol and its updating.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: In writing. In analysing the proposal on the fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau, the rapporteur points out several points that should be corrected in the next renegotiation. He proposes a non-legislative resolution on this agreement containing recommendations to the Commission. The text, put to the vote, states that the fight against illegal fishing should be strengthened. As such, the agreement should promote the development of the fisheries sector in Guinea-Bissau, as well as that of industries and related activities, through a better distribution of added value. I consider that the suggestions proposed in this report are beneficial for Guinea-Bissau and for the Member States. They aim to improve the foundations of the future agreement. That is why I voted for this motion for a resolution.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing. \u2012 The report fully declines EU demands on sustainable fishing, employment on board EU vessels of local population and the fight against illegal fishing. Noting that it is accepted, among other things, that Guinea-Bissau has not complied with the sanitary hygiene standards for fisheries, in continuity with the opinion on the agreement itself, I voted against it.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. ‒ While this report contained some positive merits specifically when it comes to investing in sustainable small-scale fisheries and socio-economic development, it failed to promote the more genuinely sustainable development of Guinea-Bissau’s fisheries sector and of related industries and activities, in particular small scale fisheries that greatly contribute to food security and local livelihoods. Moreover, it can be argued that the agreement does not go far enough in the context of securing and guaranteeing employment for local fishermen on-board EU vessels, it more or less states that opportunities for it employment should be exploited. Furthermore, while there is acknowledgment of the importance of gathering data on catches and conservation, there is not enough emphasis on the environment and conservation. It was for these reasons amongst others that I voted against this report.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ Whilst I voted against the agreement, for the reasons outlined in that explanation, the report itself contains some mitigating positive features. For example, it wants to provide for local fisheries and processing. I therefore chose to abstain.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of providing fishing opportunities in Guinea-Bissau for the European Union. Doing so will increase the relationships within that region. With this partnership, different ways can be explored of helping to develop long-term fishing policies for this region. This will not only benefit Guinea-Bissau but also for Europe in that region in the future.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report because in this way the European Parliament was able to highlight the critical issues and problems related to transparency, illegal fishing and monitoring by the bodies responsible for monitoring the implementation of the agreement.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: Writing. \u2012 Strengthening cooperation between the EU and Guinea Bisau is necessary in order to establish a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and the responsible exploitation of fisheries resources in the Guinea Bisau fishing zone in the interests of both parties.

name: Salvatore CICU
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Guinea-Bissau. The first agreement between the EU and Guinea-Bissau was initialled in 1980 and allowed European fleets access to Guinea-Bissau's waters for their fishing activities. A new protocol was concluded in 2012, but was not enforced due to a coup in Guinea-Bissau. In November 2014, after elections were held in the country, it was possible to sign a new protocol implementing the fisheries agreement between the EU and Guinea-Bissau valid for three years. The financial contribution envisaged is EUR 9.2 million, of which EUR 3 million is for support for the development of guinea-bissau's fisheries sector.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report because I consider it very important, as my party's line in which we are very cohesive on these issues also underlines, to better manage the development and growth of relations and partnerships with third countries in the European Union, especially with regard to internal food sustainability. I agree with the rapporteur that we need to revisit the old agreements which date back years and which are in danger of being obsolete. Fishing must not, in fact, attack the important balances of the ecosystem.

name: Carlos COELHO
text: in writing. \u2012 The general objective of this Protocol is to foster cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau in the fisheries field, to create a partnership framework within which a sustainable fisheries policy is developed and, at the same time, sustainable exploitation of resources in the Exclusive Economic Zone of the Republic of Guinea Bissau. I support this report because I believe it is essential that the Commission continue to support the Guinea-Bissau authorities in improving the fisheries surveillance and control system in Guinean territorial waters in order to step up the fight against illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing. I agree with the need for a better link between the sectoral support provided under the fisheries agreement and the instruments available in the context of development cooperation, in particular the European Development Fund (EDF). I believe that Parliament should be fully informed, at all stages, of the procedures relating to the protocol or its renewal.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing. \u2012 I fully support this protocol as the EU-Guinea-Bissau fisheries agreement can be considered one of the most important currently in force and one of the few EU fisheries agreements that allows access to mixed fishing activities. In addition, as yet another example of the triumph of the transcontinental diplomatic dialogue promoted by the European Union, this agreement makes it possible to satisfy bilateral interests for the contractors: for Europe it will promote the development of the fish market while having contributed to the recovery of the coffers of the State of Guinea-Bissau, one of the countries with the lowest GDP per capita in the world. However, I also agree that it is necessary to carry out a more detailed assessment and weighting of the agreement, adopting a non-legislative resolution containing considerations and recommendations that the European Commission will have to take into account during the period of validity of this protocol and in any future negotiation of that protocol. I also share the rapporteur's view on the need to improve the quantity and reliability of information on catches and, in general, on the conservation status of fishery resources, as well as support for the development of guinea-bissau's own capacity to acquire such information.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour of the conclusion of the protocol with Guinea Bissau, as this provides for a continued cooperation agreement on sustainable fishing. However, the extension of the agreement must be characterised by better coordination on sectorial support and the collection of more reliable data on catches and on the conservation status of the fishery resources.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain at the heart of the framework for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. Guinea-Bissau, after thirty-five years of agreements, remains mired in poverty and its fisheries sector remains unwrapped. The European Union uses its economic supremacy to impose agreements that actually benefit industrial fishing. These agreements, in order to be carried out on an equal footing, would have to be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of the peoples, so that no State or group of States should wipe out the resources of third parties. Since the report by Mr Joao Ferreira also set out this analysis, I voted in favour.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ This report deals with a new fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau. In the report adjacent to the recommendation for the Parliament to approve the signing of a new protocol, the rapporteur states that a more detailed assessment and study should be made of this agreement and he asks for more reliable data on catches and on the conservation status of fishery resources in general. I agree with this approach, hence I voted in favour of this report.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: In writing. This initiative report aims to express Parliament's comments on the fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau as part of the Council's adoption of the protocol between the EU and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. The report highlights the lack of results for the 35-year-old fisheries agreement and the lack of reliable information on the conservation of fisheries resources. Parliament also calls on the Commission to set concrete targets for the development of traditional fishing and the employment of local seafarers on EU vessels. Parliament calls for immediate and full information at all stages of the procedures related to the new protocol and its renewal. Considering that this report rightly underlines the scope for progress to increase the benefits of this partnership, I voted in favour of this text.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. While the agreement proposed by the report proposes to support only continues what was established by the 2012 agreement, it does allow for a reassessment of fish stocks and thus reliable data. The situation in guinea-Bissau is of particular concern as illegal fishing continues to progress and Guinea-Bissau does not have the means to carry out an effective fight against these practices. I support this partnership agreement, which is intended to be a positive game for both sides as European ships will have better access to guinea-Bissau's maritime space. So I voted for this report.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
