text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Agreements between the EU and third countries should be sought which promote the development of the Member States of the European Union without prejudice to their national and economic interests. This agreement harms the interests of our country because it will reduce fishing in our country because catches from third countries acquired at a much lower cost will be promoted.

name: Norbert ERDŐS
text: Writing. \u2012 In accordance with the guidelines of the European People's Party, I voted in favour of the adoption of a Protocol amending the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and Guinea-Bissau. It is also clear from the report on the new Protocol that, in order to maintain marine fish stocks, the European Union is being forced to impose appropriate restrictions on sea fishing. 30% of the earth's seas are overfished and marine fish stocks are at risk. Justified steps to maintain them will result in a continuous and significant reduction in the amount of marine fish fish fished. Therefore, the common fisheries policy should pay much more attention to sustainable fish farming, i.e. aquaculture, and in particular freshwater fish farming. A significant number of fish ponds in Hungary are located in Natura 2000 sites. These farms do not pose any threat to the natural assets of these areas. Moreover, in many cases it is precisely because of our closed-system fish ponds that they have created or preserved individual wetland associations. Consequently, freshwater aquaculture should be prioritised and given as much EU support as possible. Furthermore, this area should be freed from unduly stringent and unnecessary sustainability standards, which are justified only for sea fishing.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. \u2012 The general objective of the Protocol is to increase cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau in the fisheries field, in the interests of both Parties, by creating a partnership framework in which a sustainable fisheries policy is developed and, at the same time, sustainable fisheries resources in the Exclusive Economic Zone of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. I therefore believe that this agreement is of great importance both for Guinea-Bissau and for the EU fleets operating in the waters of that country. However, because, according to the report, the results obtained are not entirely satisfactory, the European Commission must take all necessary measures – creating mechanisms for greater transparency, accountability and participation of beneficiaries, in particular fishing communities that engage in small-scale artisanal fishing – to ensure an effective reversal of the path taken in recent decades.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. \u2012 I am voting against because, by the same rapporteur's admission, very little has been achieved in the objectives of cooperation with the country in question.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Agreements between the EU and third countries should be sought to promote the development of the Member States of the European Union without prejudice to their national and economic interests. This agreement harms the interests of my country because it will cause fishing to be reduced in Greece, since catches from third countries acquired at much lower cost will be promoted. For the above reasons, my vote is against.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ I support the implementation of the Fisheries partnership Agreements with Guinea Bissau, Capo Verde and Madagascar, as they will provide fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the exclusive economic zones within the limits of the available surplus. They will grant support to the development of a good fisheries policy and grant EU vessels more fishing opportunities while respecting the environment. At the same time, they will help the development of a sustainable fisheries policy in those countries and promote the responsible exploitation of fishery resources. Those Protocols are of great importance from a financial perspective and for the country’s economy, in particular for the fisheries sector and the development of the local fisheries industry, and provides for enhanced scientific and administrative cooperation, while combating IUU fishing (Illegal, Unreported and Unregulated). Considering their importance for the partner countries and the EU fleets operating in these waters, I support their approval.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: Writing. \u2012 In my view, the fisheries agreement with Guinea-Bissau is of even greater importance and may be considered the most important of the agreements currently in force. I regret that the end of unilateral tariff discounts and the entry into force of the so-called Economic Partnership Agreements are severe restrictions and can pose serious risks and dangers to the country. In agreement with the rapporteur, I consider it important that Parliament approves the conclusion of this Protocol, given that the Protocol is of great importance both for Guinea-Bissau and for eu fleets operating in the country's waters. Furthermore, a more detailed assessment and consideration of the background and future possibilities of the agreement and the agreement would be necessary since the first fisheries agreement between the EU and Guinea-Bissau was signed 35 years ago, and the progress made in sectoral cooperation is extremely modest. This urgently needs to change. The agreement should promote the real sustainable development of guinea's fisheries sector and related industries and activities, increasing the added value remaining in the country as a result of the exploitation of the country's natural resources.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: Writing. I support the Fisheries Partnership Agreements.  They are of immense importance to the non-EU countries of Guinea-Bissau, Cape Verde and Madagascar, as the financial performance of the fisheries sector and hence their economic development is driven by the financial performance. The people living there are not themselves able to use their natural fish resources. For us, these agreements are equally important, as they allow the European fishing fleet to fish in the waters of the partner countries. This will strengthen cooperation between the EU and Guinea-Bissau.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ President, I voted in favour of this report given the Protocol provides fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the exclusive economic zone of Guinea-Bissau within the limits of the available surplus. It aims to help the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and to promote the responsible exploitation of fishery resources. The Protocol is of great importance for Guinea-Bissau from a financial perspective and for the country’s economy, in particular for the fisheries sector and the development of the local fisheries industry. It provides for enhanced scientific and administrative cooperation, also with a view to combating IUU fishing.

name: Juan Carlos GIRAUTA VIDAL
text: in writing. ‒ I welcome this non—legislative resolution as it explains the views of the Fisheries Committee, presenting a balanced approach. I support this document as despite the difficulties clearly ongoing in Guinea-Bissau, fisheries cooperation with the EU remains a positive development.

name: Sylvie GODDYN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this agreement which will allow fishing vessels of the European Union to fish in the waters of Guinea-Bissau.  This is an important agreement as it involves 28 surface seiner/longliner tuna, 12 tuna caning, as well as a number of shrimp trawlers and freezer trawlers. France will benefit directly from this agreement, as it will be able to send 12 surface seiner and longliner tuna boats to the area and 3 tuna canning boats.  This agreement is also beneficial for Guinea-Bissau, which will receive 9,200,000 euros per year, of which 3,000,000 euros will be provided under the sectoral policy, which includes the development of port infrastructure.  In addition, each EU trawler will have to board sailors from Guinea-Bissau.  Finally, since Guinea-Bissau does not have the means to combat illegal fishing, its fishing area will be monitored by European vessels which will also collect scientific data to monitor the evolution of fish stocks. This agreement therefore plays the role of a development agreement, as it contributes to the political and economic stability of Guinea-Bissau.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. We voted against this report, as it does not meet the sustainable fishing criteria. We also consider that EU inputs do not benefit as indicated in the country's development report as the proposed plan lacks measurable objectives on this.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report because I feel that it will improve the EU’s relations with Guinea-Bissau, especially after the coup d’état in 2012, as well as improving opportunities for the fishing industries in the EU and Guinea-Bissau.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report containing a motion for a non-legislative resolution. I consider the partnership between the EU and Guinea-Bissau to be highly potential, as it pursues a sustainable fisheries policy while exploiting fishery resources in a responsible and sustainable way in the Guinea-Bissau exclusive economic zone. Also it stresses to obtain an appropriate share, corresponding to the interests of the EU fleets, of the fishing surpluses available. Moreover, this partnership is the solution to the need to reinforce measures to prevent illegal, unreported and unregulated fish, as well as the need to install mechanisms for increased transparency, accountability and participation of beneficiaries. All in all, I am in favour of this non—legislative resolution.

name: Pablo IGLESIAS
text: in writing. We voted against this report, as it does not meet the sustainable fishing criteria. We also consider that EU inputs do not benefit as indicated in the country's development report as the proposed plan lacks measurable objectives on this.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒voted for a proposal for a non-legislative resolution by the European Parliament on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of the Protocol establishing fishing opportunities and the financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, as the Protocol, in addition to strengthening cooperation in fisheries and fisheries policy, improves the socio-economic disadvantages of the development of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau.  This allows EU fleets access to mixed fisheries and the funding available to the Republic of Guinea-Bissau has a significant impact on its budget. However, greater accountability and transparency should be addressed in order to bridge unsatisfactory results in the field of sectoral cooperation. In addition, I also support the prevention of illegal fishing and the promotion of sustainable development of fisheries policy, with great attention to the conservation of fishing resources.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the resolution on the fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau. In particular, the resolution reminds that Parliament must be informed at all stages of the procedure and that measures to prevent illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing in Guinea-Bissau waters should be strengthened. I think these proposals are moving in the right direction and will promote sustainable resource management.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. As with the recommendation, I voted in favour of the report as it allows for sustainable fishing in Guinea-Bissau.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. I am voting in favour of this report as it clearly sets out the problem of financing fisheries in that country and opens up opportunities for Europe.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the agreement, as it provides fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the exclusive economic zone of Guinea—Bissau within the limits of the available surplus. It is also of great importance for Guinea-Bissau from a financial perspective but also when it comes to rebuilding its fisheries sector and developing its local fisheries industry. It is an essential tool to add value to the fishing process and ultimately to export fisheries products into the EU.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this proposal. The overall objective of the Protocol is to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau in the fisheries sector in the interests of both parties, through the establishment of a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy. It considered that this agreement was of considerable importance both to Guinea-Bissau and to the European fleets operating in Guinea-Bissau's waters and recalls that this agreement should promote a more effective and sustainable development of guinea-bissau's fisheries sector, as well as related industries and activities.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the non-legislative resolution on the fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau. This agreement allows access for European Union fishing vessels to the waters of Guinea-Bissau: 28 surface seiners/longliners, 12 tuna caners and an unspecified number of shrimp trawlers and freezer trawlers. Specifically for France, it is 12 tuna seiners and surface longliners, and 3 tuna caneers. The agreement covers a three-year period. It will have to be evaluated after this period, but overall it is a good agreement for the Europeans and for Guinea-Bissau, which is failing to combat illegal fishing.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain at the heart of the framework for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. Guinea-Bissau, after thirty-five years of agreements, remains mired in poverty and its fisheries sector remains unwrapped. The European Union uses its economic supremacy to impose agreements that actually benefit industrial fishing. These agreements, in order to be carried out on an equal footing, would have to be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of the peoples, so that no State or group of States should wipe out the resources of third parties. Since the report by Mr Joao Ferreira also set out this analysis, I voted in favour.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. The European Parliament approves this agreement on the basis of the importance it attaches to both sides. However, it believed that more work could be done in the field of sectoral cooperation. The Convention also needs to promote more effective and sustainable development of the fisheries sector, in particular small-scale fisheries, as they are an engine of local livelihoods and food security. Similarly, the report calls for strengthening measures to prevent illegal fishing and urges the European Commission to continue to assist the African country's authorities in improving the system of monitoring and control of fisheries in territorial waters. For these reasons I am in favour of the report and voted accordingly.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. ‒The first fisheries agreement between the EEC and Guinea-Bissau was concluded in 1980, and by June 2012 fleets of EEC Member States had access to fishing opportunities in waters. The new Protocol implementing the Fishing Treaty between Guinea-Bissau and the EU was signed on 24 November 2014 for a period of 3 years. This Agreement promotes the truly sustainable development of Guinea-Bissau's fisheries sector, in particular local industries, but also highlights the need to establish better links between sectoral support provided under the Fisheries Agreement and available instruments under development cooperation, in particular the European Development Fund. This is also one of the few European Union Fisheries Agreements that gives it access to mixed fisheries. It is considered that it should make full use of the Protocol envisaged employment opportunities for local seafarers on EU vessels. I supported MeP Ferreira's report, as the European Union needs to do its utmost to ensure that sustainable fisheries agreements concluded with third countries are in the interests of both sides.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: Writing. \u2012 Good report, I voted in favour!

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the report on the proposal for a Council decision on the conclusion of the Protocol on the definition of fishing opportunities and financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bisau for the reasons I mentioned in detail in my speech to the plenary of the European Parliament on 8/9/2015.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: In writing. I voted for this agreement because it is advantageous for both parties. On the Guinea-Bissau side, this agreement is essential for the stability of the country because it does not have the means to fight illegal fishing alone. In addition, this agreement will have a positive impact on its level of employment as European ships will have to board sailors from Guinea-Bissau. On the European side, and France, therefore, this will allow access to the waters of Guinea-Bissau, where our boats will now be able to fish. We are also promised financial rewards.

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for this report and welcome its suggestion that measures to prevent illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing in the exclusive economic zone of Guinea-Bissau should be reinforced including by improved monitoring, control and surveillance through the extensive use of the satellite-based vessel monitoring system, logbooks, inspectors and the implementation of decisions by regional fisheries organisations.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 The report on the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Guinea-Bissau: fishing opportunities and financial compensation gives me a favourable view. The idea is to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau in the fisheries sector, with advantages for both sides, leading to an appropriate sharing of surpluses of available resources. It is a priority to strengthen the profile of sectoral cooperation, despite the progress already made in the area of monitoring, control and monitoring of fisheries activities. Illegal, undeclared and unregulated (INTA) fishing remains a long-standing problem to work on, as does health standards.

name: Gabriel MATO
text: in writing. The European Parliament's report on the fisheries agreement with Guinea Bissau leaves our view on a protocol that has been raised not only on economic criteria, but on collaboration between the EU and the African country. My support for the proposal, therefore, and my wish that both the Community fleet and the citizens of Guinea Bissau can benefit from the new protocol.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. As a need for sustainable development of the Guinea-Bissau fisheries sector, as well as related industries and activities, and the EU-Bissau fisheries agreement is of great importance, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. 2 out of 3 fish consumed in Europe are imported. As fish consumption continues to grow, with slow but steady growth, a gap is widening to the detriment of southern countries. The report proposes to renew the EU fisheries agreement with Guinea-Bissau. Indeed, the coup d'état in Guinea-Bissau on 12 April 2012 led to the suspension by the European Union of the current protocols. The agreement before us allows 40 EU ships to fish off the coast of Guinea for a consideration of 9.2 million euros. Fish fishing off Guinea is clearly not essential for the EU, especially as it has the capacity and space to self-sufficient in fisheries resources. This is looting more than anything else. I am voting against this text.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: In writing. This fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau on fishing opportunities and financial consideration aims to allow EU fishing vessels access to guinea-Bissau waters.  In concrete terms, there are 28 tuna seiners/longliners, 12 tuna canners, as well as several shrimp trawlers and freezers. That is for France 15 ships and for a period of 3 years. In return, a fee must be paid and shipowners must board sailors from Guinea-Bissau. Overall, this is a good agreement for The Europeans and for the citizens of Guinea-Bissau who are unable to combat illegal fishing. I voted for it.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. \u2012 The new protocol to the EU-Guinea-Bissau fisheries agreement provides for fishing opportunities for vessels from Spain, Italy, Portugal, France and Greece. The protocol lasts for three years and has been applied provisionally since 24 November 2014. The financial contribution is EUR 9.2 million per year, corresponding to EUR 6.2 million for access to resources in guinea-bissau's economic zone and EUR 3 million for support for the development of the Guinean fisheries sector. The fishing opportunities allocated to the European fleet are: 3 700 TAB (Gross Tonnage) for freezer trawlers (shrimp) and 3 500 TAB for freezer trawlers (demersal and cephalopods); 28 freezer and longline tuna vessels and 12 tuna vessels with canes.  I believe that this is a good protocol that will help guinea-bissau's economy, hence my vote in favour.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in support of the agreement. The Fishing Partnership Agreement between the EU and Guinea-Bissau will benefit the fishing industries of both the EU and Guinea-Bissau. The agreement also sets forth sound methods to manage the fisheries resources and ensures sustainability protocols are being adhered to by national and EU fishing vessels through improved monitoring capacities.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: In writing. Guinea-Bissau is one of the least developed countries in the world and one of the most indebted countries. This poverty was compounded by a period of political instability following the military coup d'état of 12 April 2012. Since May 2014, the country has seen a positive development thanks to the holding of democratic presidential elections. The fisheries partnership agreement between the European Union and Guinea-Bissau is timely; its conclusion should enable the European Union and Guinea-Bissau to strengthen political dialogue, consolidate the country's reconstruction and revitalise one of the key sectors of its economy. The European Union's financial contribution of EUR 9,200,000 will support fisheries policy and strengthen Guinea's budget. It should enable the development of the fishing industry at the local level and improve working conditions in the field of small-scale fishing. I welcome Parliament's approval of the Council to conclude this agreement, which is an indispensable tool to reduce Guinea-Bissau's dependence on the agricultural sector and international aid.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ The Protocol provides fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the exclusive economic zone of Guinea-Bissau within the limits of the available surplus. It aims to help the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and to promote the responsible exploitation of fishery resources. The Protocol is of great importance for Guinea-Bissau from a financial perspective and for the country’s economy, in particular for the fisheries sector and the development of the local fisheries industry. It provides for enhanced scientific and administrative cooperation, also with a view to combating IUU fishing. That is why I voted in favour of this report.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 A fisheries agreement between the EEC and Guinea-Bissau has been in force since 1980 and is the most important of the agreements currently in force. On 10 February 2012, the Parties agreed on a new implementation protocol covering the period from 16 June 2012 to 15 June 2015. Following the military coup in the Republic of Guinea-Bissau on 12 April 2012, the Eu suspended the procedures for signing the Protocol. However, elections were held in the country in May 2014 and on 24 November 2014 a new implementing protocol to the EU-Guinea-Bissau Fisheries Agreement was finally signed. In his report, the rapporteur points out that the progress made so far in sectoral cooperation is insufficient and calls on the Commission to take all necessary steps to reverse the trends seen in recent decades. I supported the report.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: In writing. This agreement is to allow 28 surface seiners/longliners, 12 tuna canning tuna and a specified number of shrimp trawlers and freezer trawlers from European Union countries to operate in guinea-Bissau's territorial waters. It includes a financial consideration of 9,200,000 euros and the obligation to board sailors. It therefore appears that this partnership agreement is beneficial to both parties, especially as it will help to combat illegal fishing and to update the fisheries resources of these waters.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 I believe that future agreements should promote a more effective and sustainable development of the Guinean fisheries sector, as well as related industries and activities, in particular small-scale fishing that contribute significantly to food security and local livelihoods. I am voting in favour of this report, which advocates a better link between sectoral support under the Fisheries Agreement and the instruments available in the context of development cooperation, in particular the European Development Fund (EDF).

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. As with the recommendation, this report aims to enable European vessels to access the territorial waters of Guinea-Bissau. This agreement, particularly advantageous for France, is also advantageous for Guinea-Bissau since a financial consideration is provided as well as a fight against illegal fishing, a real scourge. As this agreement is balanced, I have decided to vote for this text.

name: Claude MORAES
text: in writing. ‒ This renewal of the Protocol provides fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the exclusive economic zone of Guinea—Bissau within the limits of the available surplus. The Protocol is of great importance for Guinea-Bissau from a financial perspective but also when it comes to rebuilding its fisheries sector and developing its local (including artisanal) fisheries industry. It is an essential tool to add value to the fishing process and ultimately to export fisheries products into the EU.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ The EU-Guinea-Bissau Fisheries Agreement has gained added importance following the suspension of negotiations with Mauritania. I voted for this report that better regulates this agreement.

name: Liadh NÍ RIADA
text: in writing. – The file does have some merits especially when it comes to investing in sustainable small-scale fisheries and socio-economic development. As Guinea Bisau is a developing country it has an underdeveloped monitoring and surveillance system for fisheries and hence there is a significant problem with illegal fishing, especially by large Russian and Chinese trawlers. The agreement states it will help develop surveillance. There is acknowledgment of the importance of gathering data on catches and conservation. However it can be argued that the agreement does not go far enough in the context of securing and guaranteeing employment for local fishermen on-board EU vessels, it more or less states that opportunities for it employment should be exploited. There is also a risk of EU vessels from larger fishing fleets who will exploit this opportunity. With the positives and negatives in mind I abstained.

name: Norica NICOLAI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this own-initiative report because it underlines very well the issues that the European Commission must take into account in the new Fisheries Agreement between the EU and Guinea-Bissau. While this agreement is a necessary and fair one for both parties, as this report also points out, it is absolutely necessary that the funds paid by the EU to Guinea-Bissau be used in a transparent manner and help to develop the fishing and fish processing industry in that country. Without such development, Guinea-Bissau will not be able to add value to its own fish products. And without sustainable and sustainable development, these funds will never be enough to help the people of Guinea-Bissau escape the poverty they are in.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: Writing. I support the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and Guinea-Bissau. Sustainable fishing is an important step for economic development.

name: Urmas PAET
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported. The document concerns the draft Council decision on the conclusion of the Protocol setting out the fishing opportunities and the financial contribution.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 Once I have understood the importance of the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the EU and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, fully agreeing with the suggestions made by the rapporteur, Nirj Deva, and especially with regard to the defence of the principles of transparency and equal treatment of access for foreign vessels in the maritime areas within the competence of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, I have decided to vote in favour.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: Written. ‒The Fishermen's Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau sets out fishing opportunities and provides for a financial contribution to the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. Such a protocol aimed at strengthening cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau in the field of fisheries is for the benefit of both countries, as it establishes frameworks for the implementation of a sustainable and long-term fishing policy.  It also pays great attention to the use of fishing resources in a responsible and sustainable manner and provides for the possibility of technical assistance needed by the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, including, inter alia, the building of institutional capacities, training of fishing experts, partnerships with small fisheries and puts a stronger emphasis on policies that would recognise the important role of women in fisheries.  Given the benefits that the agreement provides, both for the Republic of Guinea-Bissau and for the European Union, and given the broader framework covered by the agreement, which allows the development of the fishing and institutional capacities of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, I support and voted to implement it.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: In writing. In support of the recommendation, I obviously support the text it accompanies and I therefore vote for it.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: Written. ‒ Although the first agreement between Guinea-Bissau and the European Union was signed 35 years ago, the results of the consensual cooperation were largely absent. Given that Guinea-Bissau is one of the poorest areas in the world, with the lowest GDP per bed and one of the highest levels of indebtedness, but also with exceptional fish stocks, I support this report containing a proposal for a non-legislative resolution on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of the Protocol establishing fishing opportunities and the financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Guinea Bissau.  I also support the provision of this report that, in addition to €6.2 million for the provision of fishing resources, €3 million will be invested in the development of Guinea-Bissau's fishing sector in order to make the most of the fishing potential they abound in as efficiently as possible and use it for the sustainable development of the country.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. – Although the first fisheries partnership agreement with the Republic of Guinea-Bissau was signed 35 years ago, the results achieved are not satisfactory. The new Protocol, signed on 24 November 2014, offers more opportunities and perspective for developing EU-Guinea-Bissau relations.  It is of utmost importance for the EU because this agreement is currently one of several allowing access to mixed fisheries, and due to the inability to harmonise the sanitary standards of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau with the EU, this potential has not been exploited. In July 2014, the EU made efforts to establish a sanitary laboratory in guinea-bissau, which will certainly contribute to increasing the capacity there and ultimately benefiting each other.  The previously mentioned new Protocol provides a total of €9.2 million in support annually. Consequently, I agree with my colleague Rapporteur Ferreira and support his recommendation on the need for better coordination between this support and the instruments available as part of development cooperation, i.e. European Development Fund.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. The European Parliament adopted the report on the fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau establishing fishing opportunities and financial counterparties. This agreement is all the more strategic because it provides access to mixed fisheries. It is now becoming one of the most important fisheries agreements for the EU as negotiations with Mauritania have been suspended.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: in writing. This renewal is possible by the EU's decision to normalise its relations with Guinea Bissau, following democratic elections in 2014. I welcome this renewal which guarantees the sustainability of fishing activity in accordance with the principles of the new CFP, allowing the Galician cephalopod fleet access to this fishing ground, which means its return to European agreements after its expulsion from Mauritania in 2012. Up to 16 vessels will be able to operate in Guinean waters, thus easiing their situation. It will also ensure the activity of 20 Huelva seafood vessels, 14 freezer sequeros and 9 ported pipes in Bermeo, all affected by the suspension of the Mauritanian Agreement. France, Italy, Greece and Portugal also have fishing opportunities.  The Protocol will provide a disbursement of EUR 9.2 million per year, of which EUR 3 will be intended to strengthen Guinea Bissau's fisheries sector and administration. I thank the Commission for speeding up the procedure for approving this agreement, which is also a sign of support for the new democratic government and will lead to a major injection of liquidity for guinea Bissau's administration. For all this, I voted in favour.

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing. The main objective of the Protocol is to provide fishing opportunities for EU vessels in Guinea-Bissau waters within the limits of the available surplus and to strengthen cooperation between the EU and Guinea-Bissau, thereby creating a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and responsible exploitation of fisheries resources in guinea-bissau's exclusive economic zone. The overall financial contribution envisaged is EUR 9.2 million per year, corresponding to EUR 6.2 million for access to resources in the Guinea-Bissau Economic Zone and EUR 3 million to support the development of guinea-bissau's fisheries sector. Like the rapporteur, I believe that the adoption of this proposal should be completed as soon as possible, because we are dealing with a very relevant economic sector, especially in the riverside areas (European and Guinean).  For this reason, it is imperative that the agreement promotes the effective sustainable development of the Guinean fisheries sector, as well as related industries and activities, increasing the added value that remains in the country as a result of the exploitation of its natural resources.

name: Matteo SALVINI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted against because I consider the agreement in question to be disadvantageous to the European Union.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. We voted against this report, as it does not meet the sustainable fishing criteria. We also consider that EU inputs do not benefit as indicated in the country's development report as the proposed plan lacks measurable objectives on this.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain at the heart of the framework for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. Guinea-Bissau, after thirty-five years of agreements, remains mired in poverty and its fisheries sector remains unwrapped. The European Union uses its economic supremacy to impose agreements that actually benefit industrial fishing.  These agreements, in order to be carried out on an equal footing, would have to be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of the peoples, so that no State or group of States should wipe out the resources of third parties. Since the report by Mr Joao Ferreira also set out this analysis, I voted in favour.

name: Ricardo SERRÃO SANTOS
text: in writing. \u2012 This Protocol is of great importance both for the Republic of Guinea-Bissau and for the fleets of the European Union operating in the waters of that country. However, the results achieved so far in the field of sectoral cooperation are unsatisfactory. I therefore note that this report highlights this situation and calls on the European Commission to take all necessary measures, including the establishment of mechanisms for greater transparency, accountability and participation of beneficiaries, in particular fishing communities that engage in small-scale artisanal fishing. I also note with satisfaction that the report stresses the need to strengthen the component of the agreement for sectoral support. For these reasons, I voted positively for this report.

name: Siôn SIMON
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report because I feel that it will improve the EU’s relations with Guinea-Bissau, especially after the coup d’état in 2012, as well as improving opportunities for the fishing industries in the EU and Guinea-Bissau.

name: Davor ŠKRLEC
text: Written. ‒ This explanation of the vote comes as a criticism of the existing system of evaluation of the work of MEMBERS of the European Parliament solely on the basis of the statistical number of parliamentary activities potentiated in Croatia, which does not really reflect the actual quality and quantity of work, efficiency and most of all the success of parliamentary action.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. ‒I support this report because the Protocol to complement the Fishing Partnership Agreement between Europe and Guinea-Bissau is beneficial for both sides, as is the Agreement itself. Likewise, Europe has benefited from this Agreement for 35 years and should have them in the future.  For Europe, it is important that these treaties continue to fish in guinea-bissau's territorial waters and thus continue to supply quality seafood to its inhabitants. It is also good that this creates good relations between the two countries and the two continents and that both actors develop economically in this way.

name: Catherine STIHLER
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report which is a renewal of a Protocol that existed before Guinea-Bissau’s more recent turbulent times.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. The report focuses on the assistance and appropriate training of Guinea-Bissau fishermen and the strengthening of institutional capacity as well as sectoral policies, equalisation of access to this agricultural branch for both sexes and the prevention of illegal and unauthorised fishing within certain borders.  I support this report because it is extremely important if we want to cooperate with the government of Guinea-Bissau. The report notes that it is essential to provide the Government of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau with a certain amount of autonomy in collecting the necessary data so that fishing activities can be monitored throughout the year, thus encouraging suitable institutions to work better and increasing the share of the working population in the fisheries sector.

name: Patricija ŠULIN
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report with a proposal for a non-legislative resolution on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of a protocol setting out the fishing opportunities and financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. The Republic of Guinea-Bissau, whose GDP is among the lowest in the world and where two thirds of families live below the poverty line, has a large fish stock. We need to look at history and think about what we can do in the future. We need to strengthen transparency, involve local people more and make sure that this agreement has a positive impact on the local population.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Agreements between the EU and third countries should be sought which promote the development of the Member States of the European Union without prejudice to their national and economic interests. This agreement harms the interests of our country because it will reduce fishing in our country because catches from third countries acquired at a much lower cost will be promoted.

name: Claudia ȚAPARDEL
text: in writing. \u2012 Fishing is one of the significant economic activities of the European Union, which provides 2% of the gross domestic product of the Member States. In this context, the Union institutions must give due importance to the development of this sector. Where as the law of the sea offers the possibility of exploiting maritime resources in cooperation with countries in geographical areas close to the constituent territories of the European Union, it is necessary to clearly regulate the relations of those countries with the EU from the perspective of fisheries.  The last Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Guinea Bissau was concluded in 2007 and operated until 2012, when it was discontinued due to the unstable political situation in that country. It is now necessary to adopt a new agreement, which clearly regulates fishing quotas between the EU and Guinea Bissau, all the more so since the annual financial aid granted by the EU has a considerable value of more than EUR 9 million, which covers the prevention of illegal fishing and the development of legal fishing, but also better prospects for development for that country. While there are still some problems with the efficient use of these funds by the Bissau authorities, I believe that we can support this document as being in the interests of both parties.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report and approved the conclusion of the protocol setting fishing opportunities and the financial compensation provided for in the partnership agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. The measures adopted should also help to prevent illegal and unregulated fishing in the exclusive economic zone of Guinea-Bissau.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: Written. ‒ The extension of the Partnership and Fisheries Agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau allows licensed EU member states, namely Spain, Greece, Portugal and Italy, to fish in the waters of that country, with a focus on the need to address the fisheries challenges facing the country.  Guinea-Bissau faces illegal and unregulated fishing, lack of supervision in the fishing sector and lack of accurate data on fish funds. While the problems identified clearly show that the agreement has not been sufficiently updated since 2012 to reflect changes in the fish stock, I believe that this agreement does not reflect the political changes that have taken place in Guinea-Bissau in the meantime or the difficulties facing the fisheries sector.  Since I do not think it shows a serious intention to solve these problems, I voted abstained.

name: Romana TOMC
text: Writing. As this is about strengthening relations between the European Union and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, I supported the recommendation in a coherent manner. The report proposes better management and conservation of fisheries resources with financial assistance from the European Union to create long-term country-specific plans. Because it is extremely important to plan for the sustainable depletion of marine resources, and because we need to strengthen relations between the EU and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: in writing. U2012 Fisheries partnership agreement with Guinea-Bissau: fishing opportunities and financial counterparty (report) We voted against this report, as it does not meet the sustainable fishing criteria. We also consider that EU inputs do not benefit as indicated in the country's development report as the proposed plan lacks measurable objectives on this

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: In writing. Agreement advantageous to both sides, especially since Guinea-Bissau does not have the means to combat illegal fishing. I am voting for the adoption of this text.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: in writing. We voted against this report, as it does not meet the sustainable fishing criteria. We also consider that EU inputs do not benefit as indicated in the country's development report as the proposed plan lacks measurable objectives on this.

name: Ernest URTASUN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against these two points on the Fisheries agreement with Guinea-Bissau, because the ‘new’ protocol is problematic, as it takes no consideration of developments since it was negotiated, several years ago. It thus does not reflect the standards for agreements established in the reform of the CFP. Further, the alleged widespread corruption does not reflect well upon the way in which the protocol would be implemented.

name: Anneleen VAN BOSSUYT
text: Written. 'We recognise the value of the EU Fisheries Partnership Agreement with the Republic of Guinea-Bissau as an important tool for the country's fishing industry, the EU fleets operating there and the export opportunities it could create with Europe. However, we abstain from voting on the preliminary report with recommendations and the draft resolution on the implementation protocol, because it is too much a copy of the 2012 implementation protocol that was suspended following the military coup in April 2012. There are also lacks elements for the transition to more sustainable fisheries, such as an update on the conservation situation of fish stocks. For our N-VA delegation, the current protocol does not reflect the new political challenges following the upheavals in the country and the difficulties faced by the local fishing industry.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. \u2012 This agreement provides for financial consideration paid for access to that country's resources but also to support the development of the fisheries sector. It provides for fishing opportunities for the EU fleet. The economy of this country depends heavily on agriculture. In this sense, productive diversification is one of the challenges facing the country. Artisanal fishing, including subsistence fishing, ensures the survival of many fishing families (figures vary according to estimates). However, we accompany the rapporteur on the need to carry out a more detailed assessment and consideration of this agreement, its history and future prospects, in particular in terms of sectoral support.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. As a need for sustainable development of the Guinea-Bissau fisheries sector, as well as related industries and activities, and the EU-Bissau fisheries agreement is of great importance, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Beatrix von STORCH
text: Writing. Together with my group, the ECR, I abstained from voting on this motion for a resolution. The agreement does not respect the political situation in the Guinea-Bissau region and ignores the difficulties of the fisheries sector, such as the change in fish stocks. In view of these shortcomings in the report, I abstained from voting on this motion for a resolution.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain the cover for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. These agreements do not serve to support the development of third-country fisheries sectors, but to buy from governments to keep things as they are. In the not being able to develop their own fishing sector, these countries have surpluses that we fish for. Meanwhile, artisanal and inshore fishing in the EU is being progressively dismantled by European Union and our government policies. These agreements, in order to be on an equal footing, must be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of peoples, so that no State or set of states disarms the resources of third parties. It is important to give an in-depth social debate about what these agreements really mean, both for the populations of third countries and for the European productive sectors. For the reasons set out here, I voted abstention.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. This agreement allows access for EUROPEAN Union fishing vessels to Cape Verdean waters. It concerns 28 tuna seiners, 30 surface longliners and 13 tuna canners. Of these vessels, 16 are French. This agreement is signed for a period of 4 years. Overall, it is a balanced agreement that will support the development of local fishing communities and help Cape Verde combat illegal fishing. So I voted for this text.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ I oppose these agreements, which have a whiff of exploitation about them. We should not be paying developing countries to plunder their natural resources. I therefore voted against the agreement.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this recommendation, which aims to conclude a Protocol to the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Cape Verde. It aims to strengthen cooperation between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde with a view to sustainable fisheries. In the Protocol, the Parties agreed to implement a rigorous monitoring mechanism to ensure the sustainable use of resources and committed themselves to complying with the recommendations of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this win-win agreement. This agreement seems to me to be quite balanced in view of Cape Verde's inability to combat illegal fishing. The EU, under sectoral policy, will exercise control and monitoring of Cape Verdean waters and support the development of local fishing communities. This four-year agreement will allow access to Cape Verdean territorial waters of 28 seiner tuna boats (16 Spanish and 12 French), 30 surface longliners (23 Spanish and 7 Portuguese) and 13 tuna caneers (7 Spanish, 4 French and 2 Portuguese).

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this new protocol, which promotes sustainable fishing and more responsible exploitation of fisheries resources, and establishes a sustainable resource management mechanism.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. This recommendation relates to the fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde: fishing opportunities and financial consideration. It should allow EU fishing vessels access to Cape Verdean waters for a period of four years in return for assistance in the fight against illegal fishing and support for the development of local fishing communities. This agreement must be made in accordance with the best available scientific advice and the recommendations of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas (ICCT) and, where relevant, within the limits of the available surplus. Cape Verde faces three problems: illegal fishing, underutilization by some Member States of the fishing opportunities set out in the agreement (hence redistribution) and concerns about shark catches. As such, the parties agreed to put in place a rigorous monitoring mechanism to ensure the sustainable use of resources. This agreement is balanced and so I have decided to vote for it.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 Some passages in this report were unclear, which is why I opted for a vote to abstain.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. I welcome the signing of this Protocol, which will benefit 30 longline vessels, 28 freezer tuna setters and 13 tuna pipers from France, Portugal and Spain. In particular, it will benefit 22 Galician longline vessels, 16 freezer tuna setters with base port in the Basque Country and Galicia, and 7 tuna boats with port in the Basque Country. This is therefore good news for the Spanish and European fishing fleet, ensuring the sustainability of fishing activity in accordance with the principles of the new CFP. This new protocol covers a period of 4 years and offers fishing opportunities to 71 EU vessels in the field of tunids for a reference catch of 5 000 tonnes/year in accordance with a financial contribution of around half a million euros per year, half aimed at promoting sustainable fishing, including strengthening their Cape Verde monitoring and control capabilities and supporting their local fishing communities. It is regrettable that the activity has been interrupted between 31 August and 1 January with particular damage to the Spanish longline fleet. That is why I voted in favour of this report.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report, in which Parliament expresses its support for the Council decision on the conclusion of a Protocol between the European Community and the Republic of Cape Verde in the fisheries sector. This Protocol fixes the fishing opportunities and financial contribution of both parties to the agreement in force.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this recommendation because I believe that this partnership agreement with Cape Verde can bring many benefits to both parties, allowing harmonious and sustainable development of the whole region.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: In writing. The text, put to the vote of the European Parliament, aims to give a positive recommendation on the fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde. European fishermen have already benefited from access to the country's territorial waters thanks to an agreement reached in the 1990s. Since its ratification, this agreement has been renewed several times through various protocols. The agreement negotiated by the Commission on behalf of the Member States is a continuation of this partnership. The agreement will have a positive impact on the development of Cape Verde's economy, as well as for French fishermen who will have the right to exploit Cape Verde's marine resources within the limit of 12 surface seiner and longliner tuna and three tuna canners. It is concluded for four years. The agreement is well balanced and remains beneficial to both parties. Cape Verdeans will benefit from support for the development of local fishing communities.  That is why I voted for this proposal for a recommendation.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this recommendation, which aims to extend by another 4 years the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde by another 4 years. The EU and the Republic of Cape Verde have had partnerships in this area since 1990. The overall objective is to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde with a view to establishing a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and for the responsible exploitation of fishery resources in the fisheries area of the Republic of Cape Verde, in the interests of both parties. Last but not least, the Protocol contributes to the conservation of fishery resources, the fight against illegal fishing and the training and support of local fishermen.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing. \u2012 Although compared to 1990 there has been an improvement in general fishing conditions and the sustainability, albeit in the absence of specific analyses, of fishing activity, there is little financial importance (EUR 3.3 million) and its benefit to European fleets. Abstention vote.

name: Alain CADEC
text: In writing. The protocol to the fisheries partnership agreement negotiated between the European Commission and Cape Verde allows 28 seiners, 30 longliners and 13 canners to fish in Cape Verde waters in exchange for a financial consideration for access to water and support for the development of fishing policy in Cape Verde. In particular, the financial consideration allows Cape Verde to actively combat illegal, undeclared and unreglected fishing. I voted in favour of this agreement which benefits both sides and I would like to point out that Parliament wishes to be informed by the Commission at all stages of the process for negotiating fisheries agreements.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted today in favour of the recommendation concerning the draft Council decision on the conclusion of the Protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde setting out the fishing opportunities and financial compensation provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Cape Verde. With this proposal, EU vessels are being offered fishing opportunities in the Cape Verde area, always within the limits of the surplus available. The aim is to strengthen cooperation with this nation precisely in order to enable the development of a sustainable and responsible fisheries policy, by promoting an in-depth dialogue on the planning and implementation of sectoral policy and also by establishing a rigorous monitoring system. It should also be noted that the protocol allows for better management and conservation of fishery resources, through financial aid to the partner country to encourage it to implement national programmes to combat illegal fishing, as well as the creation of projects for the benefit of local fishermen, relating to safety and general training.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. ‒ There were some positive aspects to this recommendation. Cape Verde archipelago is a tiny, poor but democratic and politically stable African state. There is no reason to suggest that the government will not spend the money the country it will receive from the EU as a financial compensation for more fishing licences – EUR 3.3million – in the best way possible. Furthermore, the Commission stated this fishing protocol will be in line with the principles of a sustainable exploitation of natural resources. However, there were a number of concerning aspects in this recommendation e.g. the local fishing communities have systematically denounced the ‘unfair’ competition they face with the presence of much bigger and modern European vessels in their waters. In the local press, they claim that the EU should help them instead to buy better engines to equip their artisanal, small boats. It was for these reasons that I abstained on this recommendation.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ I oppose these agreements, which have a whiff of exploitation about them. We should not be paying developing countries to plunder their natural resources. I therefore voted against the agreement.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I gave my consent to the conclusion of this Protocol in order to improve better management and conservation of fishery resources. Furthermore, this Protocol will promote the cooperation between EU and Cape Verde, aiming to create a sustainable fisheries policy.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 The new protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde on fisheries was adopted in accordance with the sustainability measures of the new common fisheries policy (CFP), both from an environmental and an economic point of view. I therefore voted in favour.

name: Salvatore CICU
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this measure concerning the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Cape Verde, an island state in the eastern Atlantic, about 400 miles off the Coast of Africa. Since 2008, Cape Verde has no longer been classified as one of the least developed countries, but can nevertheless export to the EU benefiting from the GSP Plus generalised tariff preferences system. The main objective of the Protocol to the Agreement is to provide Eu ropean Union vessels with fishing opportunities in the Cape Verde fishing zone in accordance with the best available scientific advice and recommendations of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas (ICCAT) and, if relevant, within the limits of the surplus available. The total value of the Protocol is estimated at EUR 3 million.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of fishing opportunities and financial compensation as the new protocol provides a structure for the fishing activities of the European fleet and in particular allows boat owners to obtain the necessary authorisations in Cape Verde. I am convinced that an important intention of the European Union is to contribute to improving the management of fisheries resources through financial support. I also welcomed one of the objectives of the new protocol, namely cooperation between the European Union and Cape Verde, which will promote the development of a sustainable fisheries policy.

name: Carlos COELHO
text: in writing. The Cape Verde fisheries protocol allows 71 vessels from Spain, France and Portugal to fish for tuna and other species in Cape Verdean waters. By the end of 2018, nine Portuguese vessels will be able to fish in these waters. The protocol has a validity of four years and has been applied provisionally since 23 November 2014. I support this Recommendation on the conclusion of the fisheries protocol with Cape Verde, as this protocol strengthens cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde by establishing a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy. We also contribute to better management and conservation of fisheries resources through financial support for the implementation of programmes adopted at national level by the partner country, in particular as regards the control and fight against illegal fishing.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain the cover for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements.  These agreements do not serve to support the development of third-country fisheries sectors, but to buy from governments to keep things as they are. In the not being able to develop their own fishing sector, these countries have surpluses that we fish for. Meanwhile, artisanal and inshore fishing in the EU is being progressively dismantled by European Union and our government policies. These agreements, in order to be on an equal footing, must be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of peoples, so that no State or set of states disarms the resources of third parties. It is important to give an in-depth social debate about what these agreements really mean, both for the populations of third countries and for the European productive sectors. For the reasons set out here, I voted abstention.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ This protocol between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde is being established in order to comply with the new Common Fisheries Policy Regulation, which puts the emphasis on sustainable fisheries and good governance, while recognising the importance of policy consistency between the CFP and EU development cooperation objectives. The protocol covers a four-year period, thus providing a degree of stability. Having regard to the outcome of the assessment of the previous protocol and to the content of the new protocol, I voted in favour of giving consent to it.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: In writing. This report proposes the adoption of a protocol to regulate the fishing activity of the European fleet in Cape Verde. The protocol will contribute to better management and conservation of fisheries resources. In addition, one of the objectives of the protocol is to strengthen cooperation between the EU and Cape Verde. The main elements of this protocol are fishing opportunities, annual financial consideration, advances and royalties to be paid by vessel owners. In favour of this win-win partnership benefiting both the European fishing sector and the development of a third country, I voted for this text.

name: Rachida DATI
text: In writing. This agreement with Cape Verde will allow European fishermen to expand their fishing territory, while respecting the environment and increasing the possibility of scientific research on local fisheries and environmental resources. So I voted in favour of this protocol.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Agreements between the EU and third countries should be sought which promote the development of the Member States of the European Union without prejudice to their national and economic interests. This agreement harms the interests of our country because it will reduce fishing in our country because catches from third countries acquired at a much lower cost will be promoted. Furthermore, this Agreement does not in fact combat reckless fishing of sharks in this area.

name: Norbert ERDŐS
text: Writing. \u2012 In accordance with the guidelines of the European People's Party, I voted in favour of the adoption of a Protocol amending the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and Cape Verde. It is also clear from the report on the new Protocol that, in order to maintain marine fish stocks, the European Union is being forced to impose appropriate restrictions on sea fishing. 30% of the earth's seas are overfished and marine fish stocks are at risk. Justified steps to maintain them will result in a continuous and significant reduction in the amount of marine fish fish fished. Therefore, the common fisheries policy should pay much more attention to sustainable fish farming, i.e. aquaculture, and in particular freshwater fish farming. A significant number of fish ponds in Hungary are located in Natura 2000 sites. These farms do not pose any threat to the natural assets of these areas. Moreover, in many cases it is precisely because of our closed-system fish ponds that they have created or preserved individual wetland associations. Consequently, freshwater aquaculture should be prioritised and given as much EU support as possible. Furthermore, this area should be freed from unduly stringent and unnecessary sustainability standards, which are justified only for sea fishing.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. The Cape Verde fisheries protocol allows 71 vessels from Spain, France and Portugal to fish for tuna and other species in Cape Verdean waters. By the end of 2018, nine Portuguese vessels (seven surface longliners and two tuna vessels with canes) will be able to fish in these waters. The protocol has a validity of four years and has been applied provisionally since 23 December 2014. Fishing opportunities are broken down by 28 tuna seiners (the same as in the previous protocol of 2011-2014), 30 surface longliners (formerly 35) and 13 tuna vessels with canes (11 in the previous one). The estimated value of the protocol for the four years is 3,300,000 euros. This amount comprises EUR 1 050 000 as financial compensation for access to resources; EUR 1 050 000 in support of the development of cape verde's sectoral fisheries policy and EUR 1 200 000 for the payment of the fees due by shipowners. I voted in favour.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: In writing. I voted for this agreement because it preserves the development of small-scale fishing.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. \u2012 Small or almost insignificant improvements in relations make me opt for an abstention in the vote.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Agreements between the EU and third countries should be sought to promote the development of the Member States of the European Union without prejudice to their national and economic interests. This agreement harms the interests of my country because it will cause fishing to be reduced in Greece, since catches from third countries acquired at much lower cost will be promoted. Furthermore, this Agreement does not in fact combat reckless fishing of vulnerable species in the area concerned. For these reasons, I am voting against it.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ I support the implementation of the Fisheries partnership Agreements with Guinea Bissau, Cape Verde and Madagascar, as they will provide fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the exclusive economic zones within the limits of the available surplus. They will grant support to the development of a good fisheries policy and grant EU vessels more fishing opportunities while respecting the environment. At the same time, they will help the development of a sustainable fisheries policy in those countries and promote the responsible exploitation of fishery resources. Those Protocols are of great importance from a financial perspective and for the country’s economy, in particular for the fisheries sector and the development of the local fisheries industry, and provide for enhanced scientific and administrative cooperation, while combating IUU fishing (Illegal, Unreported and Unregulated). Considering their importance for the partner countries and the EU fleets operating in these waters, I support their approval.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: Writing. \u2012 Taking into account the opportunities for the Cape Verdean economy to make better use of the available stock on the basis of the principles of sustainable fishing and best practices in the sector, I believe that the new agreement and protocol is in the interests of both parties. I regret, however, the fact that the implementation of the sectoral aid has been delayed. The level of implementation is satisfactory, but it is difficult to determine the impact of European sectoral support compared to the sectoral programmes initiated by other development partners, in particular the West African Regional Fisheries Programme in Cape Verde (WARFP - CV, financed by the World Bank).

name: Arne GERICKE
text: Writing. I voted today in favour of the report on a Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Cape Verde: fishing opportunities and financial compensation, as I strongly support the positions and proposals of my group colleague Peter van Dalen.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: Writing. I support the Fisheries Partnership Agreements. They are of immense importance to the non-EU countries of Guinea-Bissau, Cape Verde and Madagascar, as the financial performance of the fisheries sector and hence their economic development is driven by the financial performance. The people living there are not themselves able to use their natural fish resources. For us, these agreements are equally important, as they allow the European fishing fleet to fish in the waters of the partner countries. This will strengthen cooperation between the EU and Cape Verde.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ President, I voted in favour of this recommendation given the conclusion of this Protocol will be beneficial for both the EU and Cape Verde. It will grant support to the development of a good fisheries policy in Cape Verde and grant EU vessels more fishing opportunities while respecting the environment.

name: Juan Carlos GIRAUTA VIDAL
text: in writing. ‒ I welcome this agreement for the next four years as it demonstrates a responsible attitude and understanding of how to best manage fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the fishing zone of the Republic of Cape Verde.  This agreement mainly focuses on tuna fishing opportunities and complies with the basic principles of the renewed Common Fisheries Policy. Any agreement which cooperates with local authorities to develop the fisheries sector responsibly and reliably should be welcomed.

name: Sylvie GODDYN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this agreement which allows European vessels to fish in Cape Verdean waters. This agreement covers 28 seiner tuna boats (16 Spanish and 12 French), 30 surface longliners (23 Spanish and 7 Portuguese) and 13 tuna caneers (7 Spanish, 4 French and 2 Portuguese).  In return, the Republic of Cape Verde will receive 550,000 euros for the first two years and 500,000 euros for the next two years. Half of this money will be abound of sector policy, which will include developing local fishing communities. As is often the case in fisheries agreements with developing countries, Europeans will participate in the fight against illegal fishing, which the Republic of Cape Verde does not have the means to combat at the moment. I note, however, legitimate concerns about shark catches. The European Commission said longliners traditionally fished a lot of sharks in the area but had reduced their numbers to limit accidental catches. Subsequent studies, made possible precisely by the existence of a fishing agreement, will determine whether further measures are needed to protect the shark species concerned.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report. Since it respects the sustainable fishing criteria. It takes into account development reports for the region.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report because not only will it bring about enhanced cooperation between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde, but it will also give way to a responsible use of the resources in the fishing zone of this country. Furthermore, this agreement will make it possible – or at least easier – to meet the needs of Cape Verde more effectively: in particular, its fight against illegal, unreported and/or under-regulated fishing.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for the recommendation on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of the Protocol between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde. I find it important to grant fishing opportunities to Union vessels in the fishing zone of the Republic of Cape Verde. Yet we should enhance cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde, thereby creating a partnership framework within which to develop a sustainable fisheries policy and sound exploitation of fishery resources in the fishing zone of the Republic of Cape Verde, in the interests of both parties. Not to mention the important notion to contribute to better management and conservation of fishery resources, through financial support.

name: Anja HAZEKAMP
text: Written. 'Fisheries agreements between the EU and developing countries are aimed at clearing the seas and oceans. European waters are vastly overfished. Even more fishing is devastating for biodiversity. Such policies harm not only animals, nature and the environment, but also the local population on earth. We just have to stop subsidized overfishing.  Trading another round of fisheries agreements is not going to remedy the EU's failing fisheries policy. Nor is it going to get the EU to get its faltering fishing fleet going. That is why I voted against the EU-Cape Verde fisheries agreement.

name: Pablo IGLESIAS
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report. Since it respects the sustainable fishing criteria. It takes into account development reports for the region.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for the Draft Legislative Resolution of the European Parliament on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of the Protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde on the establishment of fishing opportunities and the financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde, on the basis that this gives consent to the conclusion of the Protocol opening up fishing opportunities to European vessels in the fishing zone of the Republic of Cape Verde.  Such exploitation of marine resources must of course be subject to scientific evidence and within the limits of available resources. I believe this empowers the economy of Cape Verde and the sustainable exploitation of marine resources.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the Fisheries Partnership Memorandum of Understanding with Cape Verde, which is intended to regulate the fishing of European vessels in the Cape Verde fishing area and sets a financial consideration. This new protocol is transparent, beneficial to both sides and is in line with better cooperation in the management of fisheries resources, which is why I welcome the positive vote of the European Parliament.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this agreement because, as with Guinea-Bissau or Madagascar, this agreement promotes reasoned and responsible fishing while accompanying these countries in their development.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. I reject this report because it does not take sufficient account of the opportunities offered by European fishing off the Cape Verde Islands.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the agreement as its aim is to enhance cooperation between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde, thereby creating a partnership framework within which to develop a sustainable fisheries policy and sound exploitation of fishery resources in the fishing zone of this country.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. I agree with this proposal. The main objective of the Protocol to the Agreement is to provide Eu ropean Union vessels with fishing opportunities in the Cape Verde fishing zone, in accordance with the best available scientific advice and recommendations of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas.
