The overall objective is to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde with a view to establishing a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and the responsible exploitation of fishery resources in the Cape Verdean fishing zone, in the interests of both parties.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the legislative resolution on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of the protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde setting out the fishing opportunities and financial consideration provided for by the fisheries partnership agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Cape Verde. It is a balanced agreement in view of Cape Verde's inability to combat illegal fishing. The European Union, under sectoral policy, will exercise control and monitoring of Cape Verdean waters and support the development of local fishing communities. The agreement allows it access to fishing vessels in Cape Verdean waters.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain the cover for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. These agreements do not serve to support the development of third-country fisheries sectors, but to buy from governments to keep things as they are. In the not being able to develop their own fishing sector, these countries have surpluses that we fish for. Meanwhile, artisanal and inshore fishing in the EU is being progressively dismantled by European Union and our government policies. These agreements, in order to be on an equal footing, must be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of peoples, so that no State or set of states disarms the resources of third parties. It is important to give an in-depth social debate about what these agreements really mean, both for the populations of third countries and for the European productive sectors. For the reasons set out here, I voted abstention.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. – The partnership agreement in the fisheries sector between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde dates back to 24 July 1990 and six protocols have since been implemented. The main objective here is to enable european Union vessels to fish in the waters of the African country and to intensify cooperation between the parties with the aim of establishing a partnership framework for a sustainable fisheries policy.  On the other hand, it is worth noting the point by which the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde commit to strict monitoring in order to ensure the sustainable exploitation of the fisheries resource. It is therefore clear that both sides benefit through this agreement and therefore my vote is positive.

name: Petr MACH
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted against this report. The common fisheries policy causes and cannot be supported by environmental disasters in the EU's seas and in the seas of third countries.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. ‒ Rep. van Dalen's recommendation to sign a new Protocol to the EU-Cape Verde Fisheries Partnership Agreement aims to enable fishing for Member States' navigable facilities in cape Verde Waters. The protocol will enhance cooperation between the two sides. The value of the Protocol during its duration of 3 years is estimated at 3.3m euros. The Protocol will contribute to better management and conservation of fish resources, through financial support that would benefit local fishermen. I supported the recommendation in order to strengthen the cooperation and economic stability of cape Verde Republic.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: Writing. \u2012 The Agreement will help to continue economic cooperation between the EU and Cape Verde. I voted in favour.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting in favour of the recommendation on the draft Council Decision on the conclusion of the Protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde on the definition of fishing opportunities and financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde, because it is complete and documented.

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this Protocol. The fishing opportunities granted to EU vessels are in line with the best scientific opinions available and with the recommendations of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas, and are in keeping with the ‘available surplus’ principle. It should be noted that the new protocol lays down a reference tonnage which is identical to that under the previous protocol. The catch level is therefore controlled, but nonetheless allows fishing zones for EU vessels to be dovetailed because of the fisheries agreements concluded by the EU with Senegal and Guinea Bissau, making this agreement part of a ‘regional network of active FPAs’.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this recommendation on 'the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Cape Verde: fishing opportunities and compensation'. The main objective of this Protocol is to give EU vessels the opportunity to fish in the Cape Verde area, respecting certain scientific advice, and, above all, the main objective is to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde in order to develop a sustainable fisheries policy.

name: Marisa MATIAS
text: in writing. \u2012 This Protocol is not only an important tool for the development of Cape Verde, but is also crucial for member states' fishing fleets. I regret, however, that the Commission has not included in the Protocol a strict information on catches or on existing reserves and resources, or that it does not give priority to the country's options and/or priorities.

name: Gabriel MATO
text: in writing. The fisheries agreement with Cape Verde will be beneficial for both Cape Verde and the EU, whose fleet will be able to enjoy a stable framework for developing its activity in these waters. My support for the recommendation made from the European Parliament in this regard. I welcome the more transparency in the implementation of these agreements today and that more interest will be made in governance and cooperation issues, and that a better assessment of their development will be carried out.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. The Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde was signed on 24 July 1990. Since then, six protocols have been implemented. The text before us is intended to put in place a new agreement for a period of 4 years. The protocol allows 71 European vessels to fish in Cape Verde's territorial waters for a financial compensation of 3,300,000 euros. However, the development of semi-extensive, reversible aquaculture with no significant impact on the environment is possible within the EU. It would be more skilled than fishing off Cape Verde. I'm voting against it.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: In writing. This fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde on fishing opportunities and financial consideration aims to allow EU fishing vessels to enter Cape Verdean waters.  In concrete terms, there are 28 seiner tuna, 30 surface longliners and 13 tuna canning. That's 16 French ships for a period of 4 years. Overall, this is a good agreement for the Europeans and for cape Verdeans, who are unable to combat illegal fishing. I voted for it.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. The Cape Verde fisheries protocol allows 71 vessels from Spain, France and Portugal to fish for tuna and other species in Cape Verdean waters. By the end of 2018, nine Portuguese vessels (seven surface longliners and two tuna vessels with canes) will be able to fish in these waters. The protocol has a validity of four years and has been applied provisionally since 23 December 2014. The estimated value of the protocol for the four years is EUR 3 300 000. This amount comprises EUR 1 050 000 as financial compensation for access to resources (EUR 550 000 in the first two years and EUR 500 000 in the following two years); EUR 1 050 000 in support of the development of Cape Verde's sectoral fisheries policy; and EUR 1 200 000 for the payment of the fees due by shipowners. I think this is a good protocol that will help cape verde's economy grow, hence my vote in favour.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ Given the support of the Committee on Fisheries in moving this agreement forward, I voted to give my consent to this agreement with Cape Verde.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: In writing. The Cape Verde archipelago remains economically vulnerable despite its enormous potential in the fisheries sector. The conclusion of a fisheries partnership agreement between the European Union and Cape Verde will strengthen policies on fisheries sustainability and good governance. In addition to the payment of a total of EUR 1,050,000 for access to fisheries resources and EUR 1,200,000 for royalties owners, this agreement and its protocol provide for the annual payment of EUR 275,000 for the first two years and EUR 250,000 over the last two years to support the Cape Verdean fishing sector. This financial consideration will help revive economic growth in Cape Verde. This is an opportunity for the two partners to strengthen political dialogue and cooperation in the fight against illegal fishing, the management of fisheries resources with a focus on improving the sanitary quality of fisheries products and promoting the development of small-scale fishing.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the recommendations on Fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde: fishing opportunities and financial contribution because the conclusion of this Protocol will be beneficial for both the EU and Cape Verde. It will grant support to the development of a good fisheries policy in Cape Verde and grant EU vessels more fishing opportunities while respecting the environment.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 The Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and Cape Verde has been in force since 1990. On 28 August 2014, the Parties signed a new draft protocol. In the rapporteur's view, he believes that certain new elements of the new agreement and protocol are promising and necessary, that the agreement itself and the Protocol are in the interests of both parties, and therefore proposes the EP's agreement. In the report, the rapporteur advocates closer parliamentary oversight of the implementation of the agreement and calls on the Commission to transmit the necessary information. I supported both the report and the recommendation.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 The Protocol to the Agreement aims primarily at providing EU vessels with the possibility to fish in the fishing areas of the Republic of Cape Verde, while respecting the best available scientific advice and the recommendations of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas (ICCAT). I approve this report which provides for fishing opportunities for 28 tuna seiners (formerly 28), 30 surface longliners (formerly 35) and 13 tuna vessels with canes (formerly 11). It should also be noted that Cape Verde will receive financial compensation of €3,300,000 over the next four years, and this money is earcourse for the development of the Republic of Cape Verde's fisheries sector policy and the payment of fees due by shipowners.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. This recommendation on the fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde should allow EU fishing vessels to enter Cape Verdean waters for a period of 4 years in return for assistance in the fight against illegal fishing and support for the development of local fishing communities. This agreement will involve the best available scientists and will have to comply with the recommendations of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas (CICTA). This recommendation aims to address the three problems facing Cape Verde: illegal fishing, the under-utilization by some Member States of fishing opportunities set out in the agreement (hence redistribution) and concerns about shark catches. As such, the parties agreed to put in place a rigorous monitoring mechanism to ensure the sustainable use of resources. It's a win-win deal, so I decided to vote for it.

name: Claude MORAES
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report as this new agreement ought to make it possible to meet more effectively the needs of Cape Verde in its fight against illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing by stepping up monitoring and surveillance within its exclusive economic zone, by improving the management of fishery resources, by supporting dialogue with all stakeholders, as well as regional and international cooperation, by improving the health quality of fishery products and by fostering the development of non-industrial fishing.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for this recommendation for the protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde so that it will comply with the new Common Fisheries Policy.

name: Norica NICOLAI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report on the fisheries protocol between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde, as it supports and objectively analyses the results of negotiations between the representatives of the two parties. The new protocol with the Republic of Cape Verde is fair and necessary for both parties. It provides for vessels flying the flag of an EU Member State to have access to Cape Verde's marine resources and for the EU to compensate for this access by paying EUR 3.3 million over the next 4 years. These agreements, concluded on the basis of the new principles contained in the Common European Fisheries Policy, are essential for both European fishermen and consumers and third countries. It is very important that, in this protocol, the fight against illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing is a focal point, and the Republic of Cape Verde has committed itself to using the amounts paid by the EU in this fight. At the same time, it is essential that all the activity of EU vessels is monitored and analysed to ensure that we use marine resources sustainably and in line with the objectives of our own common fisheries policy.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: Writing. I voted against this recommendation because, in my opinion, it provides insufficient an overview of the real significance of the fisheries agreement with the Republic of Cape Verde. Essential aspects of regional specificities and differences compared to other fisheries agreements are not taken into account or incompletely reproduced.

name: Younous OMARJEE
text: In writing. I voted against this report on the fisheries protocol signed between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde, which allows 71 European vessels to fish in the territorial waters of Cape Verde in exchange for a financial consideration of 3,300,000 euros.  Although the latest protocol provides for measures to strengthen monitoring of exploitation and sectoral support for development, I consider that investments to support the development of Cape Verde's fishing activities are far from sufficient to justify such looting.

name: Urmas PAET
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported. The aim of the Agreement is to strengthen cooperation between the EU and Cape Verde by creating a partnership framework for the development of sustainable fisheries policy and responsible exploitation of fisheries resources in the fishing zone of the Republic of Cape Verde.

name: Rolandas PAKSAS
text: Writing. – I voted in favour of this recommendation on the conclusion of the Protocol. In particular, the Protocol will strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde and ensure the development of sustainable and responsible fishing. This agreement will benefit both parties. Secondly, European Union fishing vessels will be able to fish in cape Verde's fishing zone. In the context of sustainable fishing, it is necessary to ensure that the allowable catches of fish stocks are determined on the basis of specific reliable research data. It should be noted that financial support for the implementation of programmes adopted at national level by the partner country will contribute to the better conservation and management of fisheries resources, in particular control and the fight against illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 I have taken into account the importance of concluding a protocol between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde on fisheries, the main objective of which is to strengthen cooperation between the two for the development of sustainable and responsible fisheries. In particular, I believe it is essential to supplement the protocol with a legal collection of rules aimed at a better understanding of both parties. For these reasons, I have chosen to vote in favour.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: Written. ‒ Taking into account the long and good cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde regarding the field of fishing and fisheries, I consider that the extension of the Protocol establishing fishing opportunities and the financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde is beneficial for both parties. Increasing cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde by creating a partnership framework is useful for creating a sustainable fisheries policy and exploiting fishing resources in the fishing zone within the Territory of the Republic of Cape Verde, and for the mutual benefit of both the Republic of Cape Verde and the European Union.  Monitoring all fishing activities for illegal fishing and contributing financially to the fishing policy of the Republic of Cape Verde is of utmost importance in order to be able to fight illegal fishing together through established and safe mechanisms. Given the multiple benefits that this Protocol and agreement will bring to both the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde, and especially fishermen, I support this Protocol.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: In writing. This recommendation on the fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde should allow EU fishing vessels to enter Cape Verdean waters for a period of four years in return for assistance in the fight against illegal fishing and support for the development of local fishing communities. This agreement will involve the best available scientists and will have to comply with the recommendations of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas (CICTA). This recommendation aims to address the three problems facing Cape Verde: illegal fishing, the under-utilization by some Member States of fishing opportunities set by the agreement (hence redistribution) and concerns about shark catches. As such, the parties agreed to put in place a rigorous monitoring mechanism to ensure the sustainable use of resources. It's a win-win deal, so I decided to vote for it.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: Written. ‒I support the contractor's recommendation on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of the Protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde on the establishment of fishing opportunities and the financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde.  I agree with the view that this is a Protocol of Benefit for both parties in order to provide access to fish resources, but also to make sustainable use of them.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. – I welcome the recommendation of my colleague Van Dalen on the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with the Republic of Cape Verde and support the conclusion of this agreement which is in the interest of both parties. The economy of the Republic of Cape Verde will prosper with better exploitation of its resources in accordance with the principles of sustainable fisheries, while the European Union will gain access to the fishing area of the Republic of Cape Verde.  I also agree with the rapporteur's view that some aspects of the agreement should be improved through a deeper analysis of the previous agreement. Accordingly, and according to the report on the results of the implementation of the aforementioned previous agreement, it is necessary to anticipate as precisely as possible the effects that will be achieved by implementing the new agreement.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. Parliament expressed its support for the recommendation on the new protocol for the implementation of the fisheries partnership agreement between the EU and Cape Verde. This agreement aims to provide fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the fishing area of the Republic of Cape Verde. The financial contribution over four years would amount to 3.3 million euros, of which 1 million would be earmarked for the development of the fishing sector in Cape Verde. I voted for this report, which aims to strengthen our cooperation with Cape Verde.

name: Paulo RANGEL
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of concluding the Protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde fixing the fishing opportunities and financial consideration provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Cape Verde because I believe that it contributes to strengthening cooperation between the parties, safeguarding their mutual interests and creating a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and a responsible exploitation of fisheries resources in the fishing area of the Republic of Cape Verde.

name: Frédérique RIES
text: In writing. At noon, the European Parliament gave its approval for the conclusion of a new protocol under the fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde. As a reminder, this agreement signed in July 1990 provides fishing opportunities for European vessels in the territorial waters of the Republic of Cape Verde in exchange for financial aid. This seventh protocol covers a four-year period for this island state, which since 2008 has not been one of the least developed countries (LDCs) that benefit from a special tariff preference regime. Despite this change in status, this archipelago, composed of ten islands and five islets, enjoys an undiversified economy increasingly based on tourism.  This financial assistance, to the tune of 3,300,000 euros, gives it the opportunity to revive its economy while allowing a sustainable exploitation of resources, with particular attention being paid to the capture of sharks very present in this part of the Atlantic Ocean. In practice, this protocol provides for increased fishing opportunities for large European vessels: 28 seiner tuna, 30 surface longliners and 13 tuna caning.

name: Liliana RODRIGUES
text: in writing. \u2012 This Protocol of Agreement aims primarily at strengthening cooperation between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde by establishing a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and responsible exploitation of fisheries resources in the fisheries area of the Republic of Cape Verde, in the interests of both parties.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: in writing. I welcome the signing of this Protocol, which will benefit 30 longline vessels, 28 freezer tuna setters and 13 tuna pipers from France, Portugal and Spain. In particular, it will benefit 22 Galician longline vessels, 16 freezer tuna setters with base port in the Basque Country and Galicia, and 7 tuna boats with port in the Basque Country. This is therefore good news for the Spanish and European fishing fleet, ensuring the sustainability of fishing activity in accordance with the principles of the new CFP.  This new protocol covers a period of 4 years and offers fishing opportunities to 71 EU vessels in the field of tunids for a reference catch of 5,000 tonnes/year in accordance with a financial contribution of around half a million euros per year, half aimed at promoting sustainable fishing, including strengthening their Cape Verde monitoring and control capabilities and supporting their local fishing communities. It is regrettable that the activity has been interrupted between 31 August and 1 January with particular damage to the Spanish longline fleet. That is why I voted in favour of this report.

name: Massimiliano SALINI
text: in writing. \u2012 I have chosen to vote in favour of this proposal, because it enshrines the agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde on fisheries. Thanks to this pact, Member States' vessels will be able to fish in Cape Verden waters. The agreement is in line with the new sustainability measures of the new Common Fisheries Policy (CFP).

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report. Since it respects the sustainable fishing criteria. It takes into account development reports for the region.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain the cover for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. These agreements do not serve to support the development of third-country fisheries sectors, but to buy from governments to keep things as they are. In the not being able to develop their own fishing sector, these countries have surpluses that we fish for. Meanwhile, artisanal and inshore fishing in the EU is being progressively dismantled by European Union and our government policies. These agreements, in order to be on an equal footing, must be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of peoples, so that no State or set of states disarms the resources of third parties. It is important to give an in-depth social debate about what these agreements really mean, both for the populations of third countries and for the European productive sectors. For the reasons set out here, I voted abstention.

name: Remo SERNAGIOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the protocol, which is to renew the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde. The agreement provides for the ALLOCATION by the EU of around EUR 2 million split over four years. This protocol will give the possibility of fishing in Cape Verdean waters to 71 EU vessels from France, Spain and Portugal. I have decided to give my assent to this agreement because I believe that the financial support that will be given to Cape Verde can help that country to combat illegal fishing and to ensure the conservation and sustainable exploitation of fishery resources. Thanks to this agreement, it has also been possible to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde, with a view to establishing a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy in the interests of both parties.

name: Ricardo SERRÃO SANTOS
text: in writing. \u2012 The Protocol allowing fishing in Cape Verde by the European Union fleet, in which I am shadow rapporteur, provides for the opening of the seas of this country to 28 tuna seiners, 30 surface longliners and 13 tuna vessels with canes. On the other hand, during the period of validity of the agreement, the European Union will pay EUR 3.3 million to the Republic of Cape Verde. In this particular agreement, I am concerned about the level of uncertainty of the impact of fisheries on shark populations, but I welcome the provisions of the agreement to study this issue in detail.  Because I think this is an agreement that benefits both sides, I voted positively on the Recommendation of the European Parliament approving this Agreement.

name: Siôn SIMON
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this recommendation because I believe that it will lead to enhanced cooperation between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde and create a partnership agreement that will develop a sustainable fisheries policy.

name: Branislav ŠKRIPEK
text: in writing ‒ I voted in favour of the resolution hearing the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Cape Verde, as this agreement will offer the possibility for 71 EU vessels to fish in Cape Verde's waters.

name: Davor ŠKRLEC
text: Written. ‒ This explanation of the vote comes as a criticism of the existing system of evaluation of the work of MEMBERS of the European Parliament solely on the basis of the statistical number of parliamentary activities potentiated in Croatia, which does not really reflect the actual quality and quantity of work, efficiency and most of all the success of parliamentary action.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. I support this report because the new Protocol will provide a framework and conditions for the fishing activities of European fleets and ships and will enable European fishermen and boat owners to continue fishing on Cape Verde. The Protocol will also contribute to better management and conservation of fish sources, in particular through financial support.  Also, one of the goals of the new Protocol is to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and Cape Verde and their joint development, but also policies that will lead to rational exploitation of fish resources in the Fishing Zone of Cape Verde. This Protocol will also help to better protect sharks that will make the European Union involundate with its developed science in this field, in order to help its partners on Cape Verde in this regard.

name: Catherine STIHLER
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this report as this new agreement ought to make it possible to meet more effectively the needs of Cape Verde in its fight against illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing by stepping up monitoring and surveillance within its exclusive economic zone, by improving the management of fishery resources, by supporting dialogue with all stakeholders, as well as regional and international cooperation, by improving the health quality of fishery products and by fostering the development of non-industrial fishing.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. - I support this report because it clearly underlines the importance of regulating relations on the scientific, trade and economic fronts between the European Union and cape Verde. The report clearly follows the guidelines set by the European Union Common Fisheries Policy (CFP) and also commits to follow the recommendations of the Atlantic Ocean Tuna Conservation Committee (ICCAT).  The adoption of this report would agree on the implementation of numerous programmes and initiatives on the national and international fronts, strengthening the policies of cape Verde, in particular sectoral fisheries policy, so that in the future Cape Verde will be a country with capable institutions to carry out all tasks required by cooperation with the European Union.

name: Patricija ŠULIN
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the recommendation on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of a Protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde setting out the fishing opportunities and financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde. I support the adoption of a protocol to provide European Union vessels with fishing opportunities in the Republic of Cape Verde's fishing zone. A close partnership must be established between the EU and Cape Verde, resulting in the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and the responsible exploitation of fisheries resources.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Agreements between the EU and third countries should be sought which promote the development of the Member States of the European Union without prejudice to their national and economic interests. This agreement harms the interests of our country because it will reduce fishing in our country because catches from third countries acquired at a much lower cost will be promoted. Furthermore, this Agreement does not in fact combat reckless fishing of sharks in this area.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ By voting in favour of the recommendation I gave my support to the new EU-Cape Verde fisheries partnership agreement. By this vote I call on the Commission to seek guarantees that fishery in this area is exploited in a sustainable and responsible way.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I supported the strengthening of cooperation between the European Union and Cape Verde, which allows 71 European Union fishing vessels to fish in the waters of Cape Verde, which Spain, Portugal and France are interested in. I find it particularly useful in terms of sustainable resource use that eu financial assistance will be used to combat illegal, undeclared and unregulated fishing, thereby also developing economic activities in the fishing sector. I believe that an appropriate level of shark protection is an essential factor in the sustainable exploitation of resources that is properly recognized in this protocol. In recent years, shark catches have increased drastically, and under the provisions of this agreement, the Commission should regularly report to Parliament on the amount of their catches with a view to implementing additional measures that will significantly reduce shark catches. Therefore, I supported this agreement.

name: Romana TOMC
text: Writing. As this is about strengthening relations between the European Union and Cape Verde, I supported the recommendation in a coherent manner. The Recommendation proposes better management and conservation of fisheries resources through financial assistance from the European Union to create long-term country-specific plans. Because it is extremely important to plan for the sustainable depletion of marine resources, and because we need to strengthen relations between countries.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report. Since it respects the sustainable fishing criteria. It takes into account development reports for the region.

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: In writing. Agreement advantageous to both parties, especially since Cape Verde is unable to combat illegal fishing. I am voting for the adoption of this text.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report. Since it respects the sustainable fishing criteria. It takes into account development reports for the region.

name: Ernest URTASUN
text: in writing. ‒ Because of the new provisions on sharks, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: in writing. The new Protocol will contribute to the delimitation of the fishing activity of the European fleet as well as to improving the management and conservation of fishery resources. We are therefore talking about an agreement beneficial to both sides, so I consider it necessary to vote in favour of that Recommendation.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. \u2012 This agreement provides for financial consideration paid for access to that country's resources but also to support the development of the fisheries sector. It provides for fishing opportunities for the EU fleet. The economy of this country depends heavily on agriculture. In this sense, productive diversification is one of the challenges facing the country. Artisanal fishing, including subsistence fishing, ensures the survival of many fishing families (figures vary according to estimates). However, we accompany the rapporteur on the need for an assessment and will consider more detailed this Agreement, its history and future prospects, in particular in terms of sectoral support.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain the cover for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. These agreements do not serve to support the development of third-country fisheries sectors, but to buy from governments to keep things as they are. In the not being able to develop their own fishing sector, these countries have surpluses that we fish for. Meanwhile, artisanal and inshore fishing in the EU is being progressively dismantled by European Union and our government policies. These agreements, in order to be on an equal footing, must be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of peoples, so that no State or group of States disarms the resources of third parties. It is important to give an in-depth social debate about what these agreements really mean, both for the populations of third countries and for the European productive sectors. For the reasons set out here, I voted abstention.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. This agreement allows european union fishing vessels to enter Cape Verdean waters. It concerns 28 tuna seiners, 30 surface longliners and 13 tuna canners. Of these vessels, 16 are French. This agreement is signed for a period of 4 years. Overall, it is a balanced agreement that will support the development of local fishing communities and help Cape Verde combat illegal fishing. So I voted for this text.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against the report, for the same reasons as I voted against the agreement. There were no obvious mitigating circumstances in this case.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this proposal, which aims to conclude a Protocol to the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Cape Verde. It aims to strengthen cooperation between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde with a view to sustainable fisheries. In the Protocol, the Parties agreed to implement a rigorous monitoring mechanism to ensure the sustainable use of resources and committed themselves to complying with the recommendations of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this win-win agreement. This agreement seems to me to be quite balanced in view of Cape Verde's inability to combat illegal fishing. The EU, under sectoral policy, will exercise control and monitoring of Cape Verdean waters and support the development of local fishing communities. This four-year agreement will allow access to Cape Verdean territorial waters of 28 seiner tuna boats (16 Spanish and 12 French), 30 surface longliners (23 Spanish and 7 Portuguese) and 13 tuna caneers (7 Spanish, 4 French and 2 Portuguese).

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this new protocol, which promotes sustainable fishing and more responsible exploitation of fisheries resources, and establishes a sustainable resource management mechanism.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. This report concerns the fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde: fishing opportunities and financial consideration. It concerns a partnership between the European Union and Cape Verde setting out the fishing opportunities and the financial consideration provided for by the fisheries partnership agreement between the EU and Cape Verde. As with the recommendation, the aim is to allow access to EU fishing vessels in return for financial aid and monitoring Cape Verdean waters to combat illegal fishing. So I decided to vote for this report.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 Although this report is partly acceptable, I believe that some passages are unclear and contradictory, which is why I abstained.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. I welcome the signing of this Protocol, which will benefit 30 longline vessels, 28 freezer tuna setters and 13 tuna pipers from France, Portugal and Spain. In particular, it will benefit 22 Galician longline vessels, 16 freezer tuna setters with base port in the Basque Country and Galicia, and 7 tuna boats with port in the Basque Country. This is therefore good news for the Spanish and European fishing fleet, ensuring the sustainability of fishing activity in accordance with the principles of the new CFP. This new protocol covers a period of 4 years and offers fishing opportunities to 71 EU vessels in the field of tunids for a reference catch of 5 000 tonnes/year in accordance with a financial contribution of around half a million euros per year, half aimed at promoting sustainable fishing, including strengthening their Cape Verde monitoring and control capabilities and supporting their local fishing communities. It is regrettable that the activity has been interrupted between 31 August and 1 January with particular damage to the Spanish longline fleet. That is why I voted in favour of this report.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this Parliamentary report, which refers to the Council Decision on the conclusion of the Protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde setting out the fishing opportunities and financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde. The Protocol aims to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde in order to establish a partnership framework for the development of sustainable fisheries policy and the responsibly use of fisheries resources in the Cape Verdean fishing zone, taking into account the interests of both parties. Parliament welcomes the new Fisheries Protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde adopted in line with the new common fisheries policy (CFP) measures in terms of environmental and social and economic protection. The Commission and the Council are invited to inform Parliament without delay and comprehensively, within the limits of its respective powers, at all stages of the procedures relating to the Protocol and its updating.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report because I believe that this partnership agreement with Cape Verde can bring many benefits to both sides, allowing harmonious and sustainable development of the whole region.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: In writing. In analysing the proposal on the fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde, the rapporteur noted a few points that he wanted to highlight. He proposed a non-legislative resolution on the agreement containing considerations and recommendations for the Commission. The text put to the vote raises concerns about shark catches and calls on the Commission to inform Parliament of the actions taken to obtain guarantees on the sustainable and responsible exploitation of these marine resources. It also asks the Commission to assess whether vessels whose activities are subject to the provisions of the protocol in question comply with their disclosure requirements. In addition, the Commission is asked to inform Parliament of the additional international agreements on Cape Verde, so that Parliament can monitor all fishing activities in the region. I consider the suggestions in the report to be positive and provide more detailed access to information. That is why I voted for this draft resolution.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing. \u2012 Although compared to 1990 there has been an improvement in general fishing conditions and the sustainability, albeit in the absence of specific analyses, of fishing activity, there is little financial importance (EUR 3.3 million) and its benefit to European fleets. Abstention vote.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. ‒ There were some positive aspects to this report. Cape Verde archipelago is a tiny, poor but democratic and politically stable African state. There is no reason to suggest that the government will not spend the money the country it will receive from the EU as a financial compensation for more fishing licences – EUR 3.3million – in the best way possible. Furthermore, the Commission stated this fishing protocol will be in line with the principles of a sustainable exploitation of natural resources. However, there were a number of concerning aspects in this report e.g. the local fishing communities have systematically denounced the ‘unfair’ competition they face with the presence of much bigger and modern European vessels in their waters. In the local press, they claim that the EU should help them instead to buy better engines to equip their artisanal, small boats. It was for these reasons that I abstained on this report.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ Whilst I voted against the agreement, for the reasons outlined in that explanation, the report itself contains some mitigating positive features. For example, it wants to provide for local fisheries and processing. I therefore chose to abstain.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I gave my consent to the conclusion of this Protocol in order to improve the management and conservation of fishing resources. Furthermore, this Protocol will promote the cooperation between EU and Cape Verde, aiming to create a sustainable fisheries policy.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report because the new protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde on fisheries was adopted in accordance with the sustainability measures of the new common fisheries policy (CFP), both from an environmental and an economic point of view.

name: Aymeric CHAUPRADE
text: In writing. I voted for this agreement because I think it is fairly balanced in view of Cape Verde's inability to combat illegal fishing. Thus, the European Union, under sectoral policy, will exercise control and monitoring of Cape Verdean waters and support the development of local fishing communities.

name: Salvatore CICU
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this measure concerning the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Cape Verde, an island state in the eastern Atlantic, about 400 miles off the Coast of Africa. Since 2008, Cape Verde is no longer classified as one of the least developed countries but can nevertheless export to the EU benefiting from the GSP Plus generalised system of tariff preferences. The main objective of the Protocol to the Agreement is to provide Eu ropean Union vessels with fishing opportunities in the Cape Verde fishing zone in accordance with the best available scientific advice and recommendations of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas (ICCAT) and, if relevant, within the limits of the surplus available. The total value of the Protocol is estimated at EUR 3 million. This report welcomes the protocol between the EU and Cape Verde, adopted in accordance with the sustainability measures of the new common fisheries policy, both from an environmental and economic point of view.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this proposal because I agree with the rapporteur's recommendations, especially on the new aspects of the agreement and protocol that look promising. I am convinced that the new monitoring system for shark catch thresholds, together with the reference to reducing the number of fishing vessels, together with the shark study to be carried out by the EU together with the Scientific Institutes of Cape Verde, are objectives worth pursuing. I also appreciated that there does not appear to be a risk of overfishing for the species most sought after by fishing vessels, and this is rightly part of the EU's objectives.

name: Carlos COELHO
text: in writing. \u2012 This Protocol aims to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde by creating a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and responsible exploitation of resources in the fisheries area of the Republic of Cape Verde, in the interests of both parties. I support this report, because the fisheries protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde is in line with the sustainability measures of the new Common Fisheries Policy, both from an environmental and socio-economic point of view. I consider it essential for the Commission to forward to Parliament the minutes and conclusions of the joint committee meetings provided for in the fisheries partnership agreement, as well as the multiannual sectoral programme mentioned in the new Protocol. Furthermore, the Commission should assess vessels operating under this Protocol comply with the relevant reporting requirements.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing. \u2012 The establishment of a partnership framework is an important instrument of cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde, which will make it possible to improve the management and conservation of Cape Verdean fish resources through financial support programmes and monitoring mechanisms for the protection of marine species. The aim of the agreement is to promote and develop a sustainable fisheries policy through the implementation of initiatives taken at national level to combat illegal fishing and the financing of local projects aimed at training fishermen in safety and respecting tuna stocks. I agree with the positive assessment of the agreement by the relevant Committee on Fisheries and I am in favour of the establishment of a monitoring mechanism by scientific institutes and the International Commission for the Conservation of Tunas in the Atlantic (ICATT). I therefore voted in favour of the draft decision, an agreement that at the same time protects each other's financial interests and the protection of the environment and natural resources.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. ‒ The proposal for a protocol to allow continued fishing activities by the European fleet and also to allow ship owners authorisation in the Cape Verde is beneficial since it will foster a new impetus for cooperation towards the development and exploration of sustainable fisheries in the area. The protocol also briefly mentions the need to improve protection measures for the shark population. I have voted in favour.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain the cover for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. These agreements do not serve to support the development of third-country fisheries sectors, but to buy from governments to keep things as they are. In the not being able to develop their own fishing sector, these countries have surpluses that we fish for. Meanwhile, artisanal and inshore fishing in the EU is being progressively dismantled by European Union and our government policies. These agreements, in order to be on an equal footing, must be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of peoples, so that no State or group of States disarms the resources of third parties. It is important to give an in-depth social debate about what these agreements really mean, both for the populations of third countries and for the European productive sectors. For the reasons set out here, I voted abstention.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ The report notes that the fishing opportunities granted to EU vessels are in line with the best scientific opinions available and with the recommendations of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas, and are in line with the 'available surplus principle'. It must be noted that the new protocol lays down a reference tonnage which is identical to that under the previous protocol; the catch level is therefore controlled. Hence I have voted in favour of this report.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: In writing. This initiative report aims to express Parliament's comments on the fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde as part of the Council's adoption of the protocol between the EU and the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. The report is generally in favour of the new protocol. It asks the Commission to assess whether European vessels are responsible for providing information on their fishing. Parliament asks to be informed at all stages of the procedures related to the new protocol and its renewal. Considering that this report is balanced, I voted in favour of this report

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. The report put to the vote proposes to accept a partnership agreement whereby the European Union can contribute to the sustainable development of local fishing activities in Cape Verde. This will be accompanied by monitoring of this exclusive economic zone marked by illegal fishing. European fishing vessels (Spanish, Portuguese and French) will also benefit from this agreement, which further opens up cape Verdean maritime space. I therefore voted in favour of this report in support of this balanced agreement.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Agreements between the EU and third countries should be sought which promote the development of the Member States of the European Union without prejudice to their national and economic interests. This agreement harms the interests of our country because it will reduce fishing in our country because catches from third countries acquired at a much lower cost will be promoted. Furthermore, this Agreement does not in fact combat reckless fishing of sharks in this area.

name: Norbert ERDŐS
text: Writing. \u2012 In accordance with the guidelines of the European People's Party, I voted in favour of the adoption of a Protocol amending the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and Cape Verde. It is also clear from the report on the new Protocol that, in order to maintain marine fish stocks, the European Union is being forced to impose appropriate restrictions on sea fishing. 30% of the earth's seas are overfished and marine fish stocks are at risk. Justified steps to maintain them will result in a continuous and significant reduction in the amount of marine fish fish fished. Therefore, the common fisheries policy should pay much more attention to sustainable fish farming, i.e. aquaculture, and in particular freshwater fish farming. A significant number of fish ponds in Hungary are located in Natura 2000 sites. These farms do not pose any threat to the natural assets of these areas. Moreover, in many cases it is precisely because of our closed-system fish ponds that they have created or preserved individual wetland associations. Consequently, freshwater aquaculture should be prioritised and given as much EU support as possible. Furthermore, this area should be freed from unduly stringent and unnecessary sustainability standards, which are justified only for sea fishing.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. \u2012 The partnership agreement will contribute to better management and conservation of fisheries resources through sectoral financial support for the implementation of programmes adopted at national level, in particular as regards the control and fight against illegal fishing. In addition, projects are planned that will benefit local fishermen in terms of safety and general training, which i agree with. Another finding is the creation of a monitoring mechanism for shark catches. If such catches exceed the threshold of 30% of the reference tonnage, monitoring should be strengthened. If they exceed the 40% threshold, additional management measures should be adopted.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. \u2012 Small or almost insignificant improvements in relations make me opt for an abstention in the vote.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Agreements between the EU and third countries should be sought to promote the development of the Member States of the European Union without prejudice to their national and economic interests. This agreement harms the interests of my country because it will cause fishing to be reduced in Greece, since catches from third countries acquired at much lower cost will be promoted. Furthermore, this Agreement does not in fact combat reckless fishing of vulnerable species in the area concerned. For these reasons, I am voting against it.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ I support the implementation of the Fisheries partnership Agreements with Guinea Bissau, Cape Verde and Madagascar, as they will provide fishing opportunities for EU vessels in the exclusive economic zones within the limits of the available surplus. They will grant support to the development of a good fisheries policy and grant EU vessels more fishing opportunities while respecting the environment. At the same time, they will help the development of a sustainable fisheries policy in those countries and promote the responsible exploitation of fishery resources. Those Protocols are of great importance from a financial perspective and for the country’s economy, in particular for the fisheries sector and the development of the local fisheries industry, and provides for enhanced scientific and administrative cooperation, while combating IUU fishing (Illegal, Unreported and Unregulated). Considering their importance for the partner countries and the EU fleets operating in these waters, I support their approval.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: Writing. \u2012 Given that the overall objective of the Protocol is to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde in order to establish a partnership framework in the interests of both parties that will enable the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and the responsible exploitation of fishery resources in Cape Verde's fishing zone, I am in favour of this report. The sustainable exploitation of resources is a top priority for both parties and in order to ensure this, the Parties agreed in the Protocol to establish a strict monitoring system. I welcome, from an environmental and socio-economic point of view, this new Fisheries Protocol between the European Union and Cape Verde, adopted in line with the sustainability measures of the new common fisheries policy.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: Writing. I voted today in favour of the report on a Fisheries Partnership Agreement with Cape Verde: fishing opportunities and financial compensation, as I strongly support the positions and proposals of my group colleague Peter van Dalen.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: Writing. I support the Fisheries Partnership Agreements. They are of immense importance to the non-EU countries of Guinea-Bissau, Cape Verde and Madagascar, as the financial performance of the fisheries sector and hence their economic development is driven by the financial performance. The people living there are not themselves able to use their natural fish resources. For us, these agreements are equally important, as they allow the European fishing fleet to fish in the waters of the partner countries. This will strengthen cooperation between the EU and Cape Verde.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ President, I voted in favour of this report  given the conclusion of this Protocol will be beneficial for both the EU and Cape Verde. It will grant support to the development of a good fisheries policy in Cape Verde and grant EU vessels more fishing opportunities while respecting the environment.

name: Juan Carlos GIRAUTA VIDAL
text: in writing. ‒ This motion for a non—legislative resolution was widely supported in the Fisheries Committee during the committee vote. Today in plenary, I voted favourably for this text as in my opinion it is the most balanced choice. PECH committee had its say lending the document thorough analysis and stressing its support for the commitment made by the EU and Cape Verde authorities to respect the recommendations made by the International Conservation of Atlantic Tunas.

name: Sylvie GODDYN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this agreement which allows European vessels to fish in Cape Verdean waters. This agreement covers 28 seiner tuna boats (16 Spanish and 12 French), 30 surface longliners (23 Spanish and 7 Portuguese) and 13 tuna caneers (7 Spanish, 4 French and 2 Portuguese).  In return, the Republic of Cape Verde will receive 550,000 euros for the first two years and 500,000 euros for the next two years. Half of this money will be abound of sector policy, which will include developing local fishing communities. As is often the case in fisheries agreements with developing countries, Europeans will participate in the fight against illegal fishing, which the Republic of Cape Verde does not have the means to combat at the moment. I note, however, legitimate concerns about shark catches. The European Commission said longliners traditionally fished a lot of sharks in the area but had reduced their numbers to limit accidental catches. Subsequent studies, made possible precisely by the existence of a fishing agreement, will determine whether further measures are needed to protect the shark species concerned.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report. Since it respects the sustainable fishing criteria. It takes into account development reports for the region.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report containing a motion for a non-legislative resolution. I truly believe that the partnership between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde is mutually beneficial yet necessary. First of all, according to the European Union’s fisheries partnership agreements (FPAs), we should promote sustainability and the development of the partner countries’ fisheries sector, which I truly believe is what this resolution is orientated at. Moreover, these agreements are beneficial to the EU fishing sector and to the partner countries, as it also strengthens the fight against illegal, unreported and unregulated (IUU) fishing.

name: Pablo IGLESIAS
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report. Since it respects the sustainable fishing criteria. It takes into account development reports for the region.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for a proposal for a non-legislative resolution by the European Parliament on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of the Protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde on identifying fishing opportunities and the financial contribution provided for in the EU-Republic of Cape Verde Fisheries Partnership Agreement, as this Protocol strengthens cooperation in the field of marine resource exploitation and sustainable fisheries policy.  This, in mutual benefit, improves the management of fishing resources through certain financial assistance programmes, and accordingly goes towards the fight against illegal fishing. However, a strong monitoring mechanism should be provided in the form of ensuring the sustainable exploitation of resources and promoting economic, environmental and economic vulnerabilities. I also strongly support rational and consistent shark protection in accordance with safe biological boundaries.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: In writing. This fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde on fishing opportunities and financial consideration aims to allow EU fishing vessels to enter Cape Verdean waters.  In concrete terms, there are 28 seiner tuna, 30 surface longliners and 13 tuna canning. That's 16 French ships for a period of 4 years. Overall, this is a good agreement for the Europeans and for cape Verdeans, who are unable to combat illegal fishing. So I decided to vote for it.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the resolution on the fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde. In particular, this resolution reminds us that Parliament must be informed at all stages of the procedure and that the latest scientific information on the status of stocks must be transmitted to it, which is in line with sustainable fishing.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. As with the recommendation, I voted in favour of the report, which allows for sustainable fishing in return for significant development assistance.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. I am voting in favour of this report as it sufficiently promotes the opportunities offered by European fisheries in these waters.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the agreement as its aim is to enhance cooperation between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde, thereby creating a partnership framework within which to develop a sustainable fisheries policy and sound exploitation of fishery resources in the fishing zone of this country.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. Mr President, ladies and gentlemen, I voted in favour of this proposal. The report welcomes this new protocol between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde on fisheries, adopted in accordance with the sustainability measures of the new common fisheries policy, both from an environmental and an economic point of view. The general objective of the Protocol is to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde, thereby creating a partnership framework.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the non-legislative resolution on the Council's draft decision on the conclusion of the protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde setting out the fishing opportunities and financial consideration provided for by the fisheries partnership agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Cape Verde. It is a balanced agreement in view of Cape Verde's inability to combat illegal fishing. The European Union, under sectoral policy, will exercise control and monitoring of Cape Verdean waters and support the development of local fishing communities. The agreement allows fishing vessels to enter Cape Verdean waters.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. The fisheries agreements signed by the European Union with third countries, however much they are disguised as sustainability and mutually beneficial to both sides, remain the cover for further exposing the resources, in this case fisheries, of the countries with which they sign these agreements. These agreements do not serve to support the development of third-country fisheries sectors, but to buy from governments to keep things as they are. In the not being able to develop their own fishing sector, these countries have surpluses that we fish for. Meanwhile, artisanal and inshore fishing in the EU is being progressively dismantled by European Union and our government policies. These agreements, in order to be on an equal footing, must be based on justice, equity, sustainability and, in the case of agreements such as this one, to focus on the attainment of the food sovereignty of peoples, so that no State or group of States disarms the resources of third parties. It is important to give an in-depth social debate about what these agreements really mean, both for the populations of third countries and for the European productive sectors. For the reasons set out here, I voted abstention.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. This is an agreement of great importance to both parties. The European Parliament welcomes the fact that this convention is in line with the sustainability measures contained in the new Common Fisheries Policy (CFP) and urges that it be noondded on the actions taken by the responsible committee in such a way as to ensure sustainable and responsible exploitation of this fisheries resource. It also stresses the need to develop a logical framework for intervention to facilitate the implementation and standardization of protocol standards. For the reasons presented here, my vote is positive for the agreement presented here.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I supported Representative van Dalen's report, as the purpose of the signing of the new Protocol is to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and cape Verde in order to establish a partnership framework for the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and responsible exploitation of fishing resources. It was decided to introduce a monitoring mechanism to ensure sustainable use of resources and an intervention framework was put in place to better manage and standardise the assessments of the Protocol. Concerns are expressed about the significant increase in catches of various shark species, which requires a specific type of action and additional measures to be taken.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour with my political group.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting in favour of the report containing a proposal for a non-legislative resolution on the draft Council Decision on the conclusion of the Protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde laying down the fishing opportunities and financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde, because it is complete and documented.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: In writing. I voted for this partnership allowing access to Cape Verdean waters to a few French and European ships. In return, the European Union will support the development of local fishing communities and the fight against illegal fishing. This agreement will therefore benefit both sides, and France indirectly.

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. ‒ I welcome the fact that this report asks the Commission to communicate annually with Parliament on the additional international agreements of Cape Verde so that Parliament may monitor all fishing activities in the region, including those that may be contrary to European fisheries policy, for example, shark finning.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted against the report on the Fisheries Partnership Agreement with the Republic of Cape Verde. The possibility of fishing and financial compensation sees an important theme within it: shark capture. This is a particularly sensitive issue to be addressed, despite a new monitoring mechanism, which is seen as a step in the right direction.

name: Barbara MATERA
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report, as I firmly believe that the promotion of forms of economic cooperation between the countries of the European Union and other states can be of great economic benefit to both parties. The aim of this protocol is to give Community fleets the opportunity to fish in the Cape Verde Republic. It also aims to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the European Union.

name: Marisa MATIAS
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour because this report addresses the need to provide the European Parliament with full information on the implementation of the agreement, one year before its end, and additional information at all stages of the process relating to the protocol or its possible renewal. In addition, the report underlines the need for an approach that should benefit both parties, as well as the need for sustainable resource management.

name: Gabriel MATO
text: in writing. The European Union has closed with Cape Verde a new fisheries protocol which, as the report prepared in the European Parliament and supported by the Report, is going to be positive for our ships and also for our partner, since not only commercial aspects have been taken into account, as had been the case so far, but the EU will work with the Cape Verdean authorities to help the economic and social development of that country.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. The Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde was signed on 24 July 1990. Since then, six protocols have been implemented. The text before us is intended to put in place a new agreement for a period of 4 years. The protocol allows 71 European vessels to fish in Cape Verde's territorial waters for a financial compensation of 3,300,000 euros. The development of semi-extensive, reversible aquaculture with no significant impact on the environment is possible within the EU. It would be more skilled than fishing off Cape Verde. I'm voting against it.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: In writing. This fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde on fishing opportunities and financial consideration aims to allow EU fishing vessels to enter Cape Verdean waters.  In concrete terms, there are 28 seiner tuna, 30 surface longliners and 13 tuna canning. That's 16 French ships for a period of 4 years. Overall, this is a good agreement for the Europeans and for cape Verdeans, who are unable to combat illegal fishing. I voted for it.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. The Cape Verde fisheries protocol allows 71 vessels from Spain, France and Portugal to fish for tuna and other species in Cape Verdean waters. By the end of 2018, nine Portuguese vessels (seven surface longliners and two tuna vessels with canes) will be able to fish in these waters. The protocol has a validity of four years and has been applied provisionally since 23 December 2014. The estimated value of the protocol for the four years is EUR 3 300 000. This amount comprises EUR 1 050 000 as financial compensation for access to resources (EUR 550 000 in the first two years and EUR 500 000 in the following two years); EUR 1 050 000 in support of the development of cape verde's sectoral fisheries policy and EUR 1 200 000 for the payment of the fees due by shipowners. I think this is a good protocol that will help cape verde's economy grow, hence my vote in favour.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted to support the agreement. The Fishing Partnership Agreement between the EU and Cape Verde puts into place important policies regarding threats to shark species in the area by over-catching. By setting up a system of extensive electronic monitoring, this agreement ensures the continuation of a healthy population for sharks in the region.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report on the Fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde: fishing opportunities and financial contribution because the conclusion of this Protocol will be beneficial for both the EU and Cape Verde. It will grant support to the development of a good fisheries policy in Cape Verde and grant EU vessels more fishing opportunities while respecting the environment.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 The Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Union and Cape Verde has been in force since 1990. On 28 August 2014, the Parties signed a new draft protocol. In the rapporteur's view, he believes that certain new elements of the new agreement and protocol are promising and necessary, that the agreement itself and the Protocol are in the interests of both parties, and therefore proposes the EP's agreement. In the report, the rapporteur advocates closer parliamentary oversight of the implementation of the agreement and calls on the Commission to transmit the necessary information. I supported both the report and the recommendation.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: In writing. The fishing partnership between the European Union and Cape Verde will provide access to 28 seiner tuna, 30 surface longliners and 13 caning tuna boats for 4 years. The financial consideration for a reference tonnage of 5000 tonnes is 550,000 euros in the first two years and 500,000 euros in the following years. In addition, the European Union is committed to monitoring and monitoring Cape Verdean territorial waters, thereby limiting illegal fishing, and will support the development of local fishing communities.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 The general objective of the Protocol is to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde, contributing to the development of a sustainable fisheries policy and responsible exploitation of resources in the fisheries area of the Republic of Cape Verde. I am voting in favour of this agreement which is of strategic importance to the European fishing communities as they will have greater opportunities to catch several shark species, as they make up 99% of the total catch. I also believe that the sustainability measures of the new Common Fisheries Policy (CFP) should be safeguarded, both from an environmental and socio-economic point of view.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. This report concerns the fisheries partnership agreement with Cape Verde, which sets out fishing opportunities and financial consideration. As with the recommendation, the aim is to allow access to EU fishing vessels in return for financial aid and monitoring of Cape Verdean waters to combat, among other things, illegal fishing. So I decided to vote for this report.

name: Claude MORAES
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report as this new agreement ought to make it possible to meet more effectively the needs of Cape Verde in its fight against illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing by stepping up monitoring and surveillance within its exclusive economic zone, by improving the management of fishery resources, by supporting dialogue with all stakeholders, as well as regional and international cooperation, by improving the health quality of fishery products and by fostering the development of non-industrial fishing.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this text, which approves the partnership between the European Union and Cape Verde for the responsible exploitation of fisheries resources in the Cape Verde fishing area. It is about promoting sustainable fishing for the benefit of both parties. In particular, the text provides for a quarterly exchange on shark catch data.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for this report that better regulates the protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Cape Verde in order for it to comply with the new Common Fisheries Policy.

name: Norica NICOLAI
text: in writing. \u2012 I supported this own-initiative report, which complements the picture on the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the EU and the Republic of Cape Verde, with my vote today. This report presents the concerns that we in the Parliamentary Committee on Fisheries had on certain aspects of this new agreement. It is very important that, throughout the duration of this new agreement, the Joint Supervisory Committee set up on this occasion closely monitors by-catches of sharks in the area, which, in the case of certain species, exceeded the quotas considered accidental.
